intent: Return a m-column calendar for an entire year as a multi-line string . Optional parameters `w` , `l` , and `c` are for date column width , lines per week , and number of spaces between month columns , respectively . With arguments `theyear`.
Return a random floating point number N such that `low` < = N < = `high` and with the specified `mode` between those bounds .
For a datetime instance d , str ( d ) is equivalent to d.isoformat ( ' ' ) .
If no arguments are given , return current ( canvaswidth , canvasheight ) . With arguments `bg`.

Called for each declared attribute for an element `type` . `elname` is the name of the element to which the declaration applies and `attname` is the name of the attribute declared . The attribute type is a string passed as type ; the possible values are 'CDATA ' , 'ID ' , 'IDREF ' , … `default` gives the default value for the attribute used when the attribute is not specified by the document instance , or None if there is no default value ( # IMPLIED values ) . If the attribute is `required` to be given in the document instance , required will be true .
Add `prefix` to the beginning of selected lines in `text` .
Return the name of the key numbered `k` as a bytes object .
Returns a new instance of the TimedRotatingFileHandler class . On rotating it also sets the `filename` suffix . Rotating happens based on the product of `when` and `interval` .
Test x for membership in s.
Set the main `type` and subtype for the Content-Type `header` . If `requote` is False , this leaves the existing header ’ s quoting as is , otherwise the parameters will be quoted ( the default ) .

Resolve MRO entries dynamically as specified by PEP 560 . This function looks for items in `bases` that are not instances of type , and returns a tuple where each such object that has an __mro_entries__ method is replaced with an unpacked result of calling this method .
Rather than being a function , range is actually an immutable sequence type , as documented in Ranges and Sequence Types — list , tuple , range . With arguments `stop`.

Add another header to the request . Note that there can not be more than one header with the same name , and later calls will overwrite previous calls in case the `key` collides . With arguments `val`.

Locate the insertion point for `x` in `a` to maintain sorted order . The parameters `lo` and `hi` may be used to specify a subset of the list which should be considered ; by default the entire list is used .
Return true if the `object` argument is an instance of the `classinfo` argument , or of a ( direct , indirect or virtual ) subclass thereof .
All arguments are optional and default to 0 . With arguments `minutes`.
Create a new SMTPChannel object which manages the communication between the `server` and a single SMTP client . `conn` and `addr` are as per the instance variables described below .

This function handles the exception described by `info` ( a 3-tuple containing the result of sys.exc_info ( ) ) , formatting its traceback as text and returning the result as a string . The optional argument `context` is the number of lines of context to display around the current line of source code in the traceback ; this defaults to 5 .
Print a table of contents to sys.stdout . If `verbose` is False , only the names of the `members` are printed .
Encode the bytes-like object `b` using Ascii85 and return the encoded bytes . `pad` controls whether the input is padded to a multiple of 4 before encoding .

Same as the standard C memset library function : fills the memory block at address `dst` with `count` bytes of value c. dst must be an integer specifying an address , or a ctypes instance . With arguments `c`.
As repr ( ) , return a string containing a printable representation of an `object` , but escape the non-ASCII characters in the string returned by repr ( ) using \x , \u or \U escapes .
Read a bytes object from the user , with primitive line editing capacity . With arguments `y`, `x`, `n`.
Return the largest item in an iterable or the largest of two or more arguments . With arguments `arg1`, `arg2`, `*args`.
Test x for membership in s.
Insert a new item with value `x` in the array before position `i` .
Create a Timer instance with the given statement , `setup` code and `timer` function and run its timeit ( ) method with `number` executions .
This function supports dynamic execution of Python code . `object` must be either a string or a code object .
Bind `fun` to mouse-click events on this turtle . With arguments `add`.
Print exception information and stack trace entries from traceback object `tb` to `file` . With arguments `etype`, `value`.
Registers the `file` handler callback function `func` . The `mask` argument is an ORed combination of any of the three constants below .
Draw a border around the edges of the window . With arguments `ls`.
Send an XOVER command . `start` and `end` are article numbers delimiting the range of articles to select .
Compare the files named `f1` and `f2` , returning True if they seem equal , False otherwise . If `shallow` is true , files with identical os.stat ( ) signatures are taken to be equal .
Decodes data from the stream and returns the resulting object . The `size` argument indicates the approximate maximum number of encoded bytes or code points to read for decoding .
Parses an XML document from a `sequence` of string fragments . `parser` is an optional parser instance .
Return the tuple as described in getmarkers ( ) for the mark with the given `id` .
Return an iterator over the keys of the dictionary . With arguments `d`.
This method modifies the Stats object by sorting it according to the supplied criteria . With arguments `*keys`.
The popitem ( ) method for ordered dictionaries returns and removes a ( key , value ) pair . The pairs are returned in LIFO order if `last` is true or FIFO order if false .

These functions all execute a new program , replacing the current process ; they do not return . The other variants , execl ( ) , execle ( ) , execv ( ) , and execve ( ) , will not use the PATH variable to locate the executable ; `path` must contain an appropriate absolute or relative path . The “ v ” variants are good when the number of parameters is variable , with the arguments being passed in a list or tuple as the `args` parameter . For execle ( ) , execlpe ( ) , execve ( ) , and execvpe ( ) ( note that these all end in “ e ” ) , the `env` parameter must be a mapping which is used to define the environment variables for the new process ( these are used instead of the current process ’ environment ) ; the functions execl ( ) , execlp ( ) , execv ( ) , and execvp ( ) all cause the new process to inherit the environment of the current process .
Create a Timer instance with the given statement , `setup` code and `timer` function and run its timeit ( ) method with `number` executions .
Raised when a local or global name is not found.

Compile the `source` into a code or AST object . The `filename` argument should give the file from which the code was read ; pass some recognizable value if it wasn ’ t read from a file ( ' < string > ' is commonly used ) . The `mode` argument specifies what kind of code must be compiled ; it can be 'exec ' if source consists of a sequence of statements , 'eval ' if it consists of a single expression , or 'single ' if it consists of a single interactive statement ( in the latter case , expression statements that evaluate to something other than None will be printed ) .

Compares two strings according to the current LC_COLLATE setting . As any other compare function , returns a negative , or a positive value , or 0 , depending on whether `string1` collates before or after `string2` or is equal to it .
Get up to `size` random bytes . The `flags` argument is a bit mask that can contain zero or more of the following values ORed together : os.GRND_RANDOM and GRND_NONBLOCK .
All arguments are optional and default to 0 . With arguments `milliseconds`.
Identify the client using a plaintext `password` . With arguments `user`.
Set the maximum time in milliseconds that can elapse between press and release events in order for them to be recognized as a click , and return the previous `interval` value .
Removes the item with the index `i` from the array and returns it .

Register the browser type `name` . If `instance` is not provided , or is None , `constructor` will be called without parameters to create an instance when needed . Setting `preferred` to True makes this browser a preferred result for a get ( ) call with no argument .

snippet: sqlite3.connect(database, timeout, detect_types, isolation_level, check_same_thread, factory, cached_statements, uri)
intent: Opens a connection to the SQLite `database` file database . The `timeout` parameter specifies how long the connection should wait for the lock to go away until raising an exception . The `detect_types` parameter and the using custom converters registered with the module-level register_converter ( ) function allow you to easily do that . For the `isolation_level` parameter , please see the isolation_level property of Connection objects . By default , `check_same_thread` is True and only the creating thread may use the connection . By default returns a Connection object , unless a custom `factory` is given . If you want to explicitly set the number of statements that are cached for the connection , you can set the `cached_statements` parameter . If `uri` is true , database is interpreted as a URI .
Convert the color from HSV coordinates to RGB coordinates . With arguments `h`, `s`, `v`.
Return a `k` sized list of elements chosen from the `population` with replacement . If a `weights` sequence is specified , selections are made according to the relative weights .
Return a complex number with the value `real` + imag*1j or convert a string or number to a complex number .
Convert an integer number to an octal string prefixed with “ 0o ” . If `x` is not a Python int object , it has to define an __index__ ( ) method that returns an integer .
Exit the process with status `n` , without calling cleanup handlers , flushing stdio buffers , etc .
Return the string obtained by doing backslash substitution on the `template` string template , as done by the sub ( ) method .

Recursive directory or file renaming function . After the rename , directories corresponding to rightmost path segments of the `old` name will be pruned away using removedirs ( ) . Works like rename ( ) , except creation of any intermediate directories needed to make the `new` pathname good is attempted first .
Return a Document that represents the `string` . With arguments `parser`.

Outputs a symbolic disassembly of the `pickle` to the file-like object `out` , defaulting to sys.stdout . Successive levels , indicated by MARK opcodes in the stream , are indented by `indentlevel` spaces .
Base class for opening and reading URLs . With arguments `**x509`.
Set `loop` as a current event loop for the current OS thread .
This will send a request to the server using the HTTP request `method` method and the selector `url` . If `body` is specified , the specified data is sent after the `headers` are finished .
Remove the first occurrence of `value` .

Locate the insertion point for `x` in `a` to maintain sorted order . The parameters `lo` and `hi` may be used to specify a subset of the list which should be considered ; by default the entire list is used .
For a datetime instance d , str ( d ) is equivalent to d.isoformat ( ' ' ) .
Rather than being a function , tuple is actually an immutable sequence type , as documented in Tuples and Sequence Types — list , tuple , range . With arguments `iterable`.
Wait for the Future instances ( possibly created by different Executor instances ) given by `fs` to complete .
Delete any character at ( `y` , `x` ) .
Put an `item` into the queue .
Return a new datetime object whose `date` components are equal to the given date object ’ s , and whose `time` components are equal to the given time object ’ s .
Compose a raw device number from the `major` and `minor` device numbers .

This exception is raised when a system function returns a system-related error , including I/O failures such as “ file not found ” or “ disk full ” ( not for illegal argument types or other incidental errors ) . The particular subclass depends on the final `errno` value . With arguments `strerror`, `filename`.
Store the value from `stdout` .
Returns `x` multiplied by `y` , plus `z` .
Return the tuple as described in getmarkers ( ) for the mark with the given `id` .
Prints the calendar for an entire `year` as returned by calendar ( ) . With arguments `w`.
Class whose instances are returned upon successful connection . With arguments `sock`, `url`.
This method prints a usage `message` including the message to the standard error and terminates the program with a status code of 2 .
Read until a given byte string , `expected` , is encountered or until `timeout` seconds have passed .
Get statistics as a sorted list of Statistic instances grouped by key_type : With arguments `key_type: str`, `cumulative: bool`.

The arguments are a string and optional `globals` and `locals` . The `expression` argument is parsed and evaluated as a Python expression ( technically speaking , a condition list ) using the globals and locals dictionaries as global and local namespace .
Returns an instance of LoggerAdapter initialized with an underlying Logger instance and a dict-like object . With arguments `logger`, `extra`.

This is essentially a wrapper around the fcntl ( ) locking calls . `fd` is the file descriptor of the file to lock or unlock , and `cmd` is one of the following values : `len` is the number of bytes to lock , `start` is the byte offset at which the lock starts , relative to `whence` , and whence is as with io.IOBase.seek ( ) , specifically :

patch ( ) acts as a function decorator , class decorator or a context manager . Inside the body of the function or with statement , the `target` is patched with a `new` object . With arguments `**kwargs`.
A ServerProxy instance is an object that manages communication with a remote XML-RPC server . With arguments `uri`.
Return True if the values `a` and `b` are close to each other and False otherwise .
Test that `first` and `second` are approximately ( or not approximately ) equal by computing the difference , rounding to the given number of decimal `places` ( default 7 ) , and comparing to zero .
Capture an exception for later rendering . `limit` , `lookup_lines` and `capture_locals` are as for the StackSummary class . With arguments `exc`.

Return a list of the DocTests that are defined by `obj` ’ s docstring , or by any of its contained objects ’ docstrings . The optional argument `name` specifies the object ’ s name ; this name will be used to construct names for the returned DocTests . The optional parameter `module` is the module that contains the given object .
Print a table of contents to sys.stdout . If `verbose` is False , only the names of the `members` are printed .
Byte-compile all the .py files found along sys.path . With arguments `optimize`.
Return True if a core dump was generated for the process , otherwise return False . With arguments `status`.
Return true if the `object` argument is an instance of the `classinfo` argument , or of a ( direct , indirect or virtual ) subclass thereof .
Get a list of frame records for a `traceback` ’ s frame and all inner frames .

Return a 2-tuple ; the first element is a string containing the command line to be executed ( which can be passed to os.system ( ) ) , and the second element is the mailcap entry for a given MIME type . With arguments `caps`.
This function drops you into the debugger at the call site . With arguments `*args`, `**kws`.
Translate an Internet `port` number and protocol name to a service name for that service .

Encode the bytes-like object `s` using Base64 and return the encoded bytes . Optional `altchars` must be a bytes-like object of at least length 2 ( additional characters are ignored ) which specifies an alternative alphabet for the + and / characters .
Similar to loadTestsFromName ( ) , but takes a sequence of `names` rather than a single name .

Return a m-column calendar for an entire year as a multi-line string . Optional parameters `w` , `l` , and `c` are for date column width , lines per week , and number of spaces between month columns , respectively . With arguments `theyear`, `m`.
For common and simple use cases , no other functionality is required . With arguments `compare`.
Default exception handler . `context` parameter has the same meaning as in call_exception_handler ( ) .
Integer value to control debugging output.

Similar to waitpid ( ) , except no process id argument is given and a 3-element tuple containing the child ’ s process id , exit status indication , and resource usage information is returned . With arguments `options`.
Set the scrolling region from line `top` to line `bottom` .
Return the “ identity ” of an `object` .

Open a gzip-compressed file in binary or text `mode` , returning a file object . The `filename` argument can be an actual filename ( a str or bytes object ) , or an existing file object to read from or write to . In this case , the `encoding` , `errors` and `newline` arguments must not be provided .

snippet: shutil.make_archive(base_name, format, root_dir, base_dir, verbose, dry_run, owner)
intent: Create an archive file ( such as zip or tar ) and return its name . `base_name` is the name of the file to create , including the path , minus any format-specific extension . `format` is the archive format : one of “ zip ” ( if the zlib module is available ) , “ tar ” , “ gztar ” ( if the zlib module is available ) , “ bztar ” ( if the bz2 module is available ) , or “ xztar ” ( if the lzma module is available ) . `root_dir` is a directory that will be the root directory of the archive ; for example , we typically chdir into root_dir before creating the archive . `base_dir` is the directory where we start archiving from ; i.e . The `verbose` argument is unused and deprecated . If `dry_run` is true , no archive is created , but the operations that would be executed are logged to `logger` . `owner` and `group` are used when creating a tar archive .
Return the name of the key numbered `k` as a bytes object .
Enable `capability` ( see RFC 5161 ) .
Return True if `obj` is either of :
Return an iterator over the variables stored in the `context` object .
Handle an unparsed entity declaration event . With arguments `name`, `publicId`, `systemId`, `ndata`.
( Only supported on BSD . ) With arguments `ident`, `udata`.
All the signal numbers are defined symbolically.

Tries to determine the libc `version` against which the file `executable` ( defaults to the Python interpreter ) is linked . Returns a tuple of strings ( `lib` , version ) which default to the given parameters in case the lookup fails .

Delete an entire directory tree ; `path` must point to a directory ( but not a symbolic link to a directory ) . If `ignore_errors` is true , errors resulting from failed removals will be ignored ; if false or omitted , such errors are handled by calling a handler specified by `onerror` or , if that is omitted , they raise an exception .
Return a `k` sized list of elements chosen from the `population` with replacement . If a `weights` sequence is specified , selections are made according to the relative weights .

Return the integer represented by the given array of `bytes` . The `byteorder` argument determines the byte order used to represent the integer . The `signed` argument indicates whether two ’ s complement is used to represent the integer .
Return a property attribute . `fget` is a function for getting an attribute value .
Raised when an assert statement fails.
Adds the specified `filter` filter to this logger .
Returns a light-weight pointer to `obj` , which must be an instance of a ctypes type . `offset` defaults to zero , and must be an integer that will be added to the internal pointer value .

Set a parameter in the Content-Type `header` . If the parameter already exists in the header , its `value` will be replaced with value . If `replace` is False ( the default ) the header is moved to the end of the list of headers . With arguments `param`.
Enter the debugger at the calling stack frame . If given , `header` is printed to the console just before debugging begins .

Returns a compression object , to be used for compressing data streams that won ’ t fit into memory at once . `level` is the compression level – an integer from 0 to 9 or -1 . `strategy` is used to tune the compression algorithm .
Return a str version of `object` . With arguments `encoding`, `errors`.
Wait for events . `timeout` in seconds ( float ) With arguments `maxevents`.

snippet: msilib.init_database(name, schema, ProductName, ProductCode, ProductVersion, Manufacturer)
intent: Create and return a new database `name` , initialize it with `schema` , and set the properties `ProductName` , `ProductCode` , `ProductVersion` , and `Manufacturer` .

Locate the insertion point for `x` in `a` to maintain sorted order . The parameters `lo` and `hi` may be used to specify a subset of the list which should be considered ; by default the entire list is used .
Bootstraps pip into the current or designated environment . `user` indicates whether to use the user scheme rather than installing globally .
Checkpoint mailbox on server .

A subclass of collections.abc.MutableMapping which stores pickled values in the `dict` object . If the `writeback` parameter is True , the object will hold a cache of all entries accessed and write them back to the dict at sync and close times .
Rather than being a function , tuple is actually an immutable sequence type , as documented in Tuples and Sequence Types — list , tuple , range . With arguments `iterable`.
Creates a tree iterator with the current element as the root . If `tag` is not None or '* ' , only elements whose tag equals tag are returned from the iterator .
Return the __dict__ attribute for a module , class , instance , or any other `object` with a __dict__ attribute .
Return a slice object representing the set of indices specified by range ( `start` , `stop` , `step` ) .
Scan through `string` looking for the first location where the regular expression `pattern` produces a match , and return a corresponding match object . With arguments `flags`.
Read exactly `n` bytes .
With one argument , returns a dictionary of column/value pairs for the specified `item` . With two arguments , returns the current `value` of the specified `column` .

Flushes changes made to the in-memory copy of a file back to disk . If `offset` and `size` are specified , only changes to the given range of bytes will be flushed to disk ; otherwise , the whole extent of the mapping is flushed .
Similar to loadTestsFromName ( ) , but takes a sequence of `names` rather than a single name .
Asynchronous version of socket.getnameinfo ( ) . With arguments `sockaddr`.
The false value of the bool type.

Compile the `source` into a code or AST object . The `filename` argument should give the file from which the code was read ; pass some recognizable value if it wasn ’ t read from a file ( ' < string > ' is commonly used ) . The `mode` argument specifies what kind of code must be compiled ; it can be 'exec ' if source consists of a sequence of statements , 'eval ' if it consists of a single expression , or 'single ' if it consists of a single interactive statement ( in the latter case , expression statements that evaluate to something other than None will be printed ) .
Receive notification of character data . `content` may be a string or bytes instance ; the expat reader module always produces strings .

snippet: shutil.make_archive(base_name, format, root_dir, base_dir, verbose, dry_run, owner)
intent: Create an archive file ( such as zip or tar ) and return its name . `base_name` is the name of the file to create , including the path , minus any format-specific extension . `format` is the archive format : one of “ zip ” ( if the zlib module is available ) , “ tar ” , “ gztar ” ( if the zlib module is available ) , “ bztar ” ( if the bz2 module is available ) , or “ xztar ” ( if the lzma module is available ) . `root_dir` is a directory that will be the root directory of the archive ; for example , we typically chdir into root_dir before creating the archive . `base_dir` is the directory where we start archiving from ; i.e . The `verbose` argument is unused and deprecated . If `dry_run` is true , no archive is created , but the operations that would be executed are logged to `logger` . `owner` and `group` are used when creating a tar archive .
This function is a decorator that is used to add generated special methods to classes , as described below . With arguments `init`.

This method sorts the list in place , using only < comparisons between items . `key` specifies a function of one argument that is used to extract a comparison key from each list element ( for example , key=str.lower ) .
Set the `state` of the encoder to state .
Called when the buffer was updated with the received data . `nbytes` is the total number of bytes that were written to the buffer .

snippet: ArgumentParser.add_argument(name or flags..., action, nargs, const, default, type, choices, required, help, metavar, dest)
intent: Define how a single command-line argument should be parsed . With arguments `name or flags...`, `action`, `nargs`, `const`, `default`, `type`, `choices`, `required`, `help`, `metavar`, `dest`.

Return a m-column calendar for an entire year as a multi-line string . Optional parameters `w` , `l` , and `c` are for date column width , lines per week , and number of spaces between month columns , respectively . With arguments `theyear`.
Return the position of `x` in the deque ( at or after index `start` and before index `stop` ) .
Parse configuration data from a `string` . Optional argument `source` specifies a context-specific name of the string passed .
Set class that keeps weak references to its `elements` .
Raised when the user hits the interrupt key (normally Control-C or Delete).

Return a possibly-empty list of path names that match `pathname` , which must be a string containing a path specification . If `recursive` is true , the pattern “ ** ” will match any files and zero or more directories , subdirectories and symbolic links to directories .
Try to switch to UTF-8 mode .

Convenience function to run a read-eval-print loop . The interact ( ) method of the instance is then run with `banner` and `exitmsg` passed as the banner and exit message to use , if provided . If `local` is provided , it is passed to the InteractiveConsole constructor for use as the default namespace for the interpreter loop .
Get the “ inheritable ” flag of the specified `handle` ( a boolean ) .
Return True if the context has a value for var set; return False otherwise.
Return a new sorted list from the items in `iterable` .

This class provides run_script ( ) and report ( ) methods to determine the set of modules imported by a script . `path` can be a list of directories to search for modules ; if not specified , sys.path is used . `debug` sets the debugging level ; higher values make the class print debugging messages about what it ’ s doing .
Returns a 3-column calendar for an entire `year` as a multi-line string using the formatyear ( ) of the TextCalendar class . With arguments `l`, `m`.
Return the __dict__ attribute for a module , class , instance , or any other `object` with a __dict__ attribute .
Return the name of the key numbered `k` as a bytes object .
This function handles the exception described by `info` ( a 3-tuple containing the result of sys.exc_info ( ) ) , formatting its traceback as text and returning the result as a string .
Return true if the `object` argument is an instance of the `classinfo` argument , or of a ( direct , indirect or virtual ) subclass thereof .
Add a `header` that will not be added to a redirected request . With arguments `key`.
Asynchronous version of socket.getnameinfo ( ) . With arguments `sockaddr`.

snippet: ArgumentParser.add_argument(name or flags..., action, nargs, const)
intent: Define how a single command-line argument should be parsed . With arguments `name or flags...`, `action`, `nargs`, `const`.
Return a string representation suitable to be sent as HTTP headers . `sep` is used to join the headers together , and is by default the combination '\r\n ' ( CRLF ) .

Return an absolute pathname of a file that did not exist at the time the call is made . The `prefix` , `suffix` , and `dir` arguments are similar to those of mkstemp ( ) , except that bytes file names , suffix=None and prefix=None are not supported .

Initialize the random number generator . If `a` is omitted or None , the current system time is used . With `version` 2 ( the default ) , a str , bytes , or bytearray object gets converted to an int and all of its bits are used .

Creates or opens the specified `key` , returning a handle object . `sub_key` is a string that names the key this method opens or creates . `access` is an integer that specifies an access mask that describes the desired security access for the key .
Translate an Internet `port` number and protocol name to a service name for that service .

Enable or disable automatic calls to add_history ( ) when reading input via readline . The `enabled` argument should be a Boolean value that when true , enables auto history , and that when false , disables auto history .
Open `file` and return a corresponding file object . `mode` is an optional string that specifies the mode in which the file is opened .
Return the nameprepped version of `label` .

This function causes the cgitb module to take over the interpreter ’ s default handling for exceptions by setting the value of sys.excepthook . The optional argument `display` defaults to 1 and can be set to 0 to suppress sending the traceback to the browser . The optional argument `context` is the number of lines of context to display around the current line of source code in the traceback ; this defaults to 5 .
Beta distribution . Conditions on the parameters are `alpha` > 0 and `beta` > 0 .

Take two ( non complex ) numbers as arguments and return `a` pair of numbers consisting of their quotient and remainder when using integer division . For integers , the result is the same as ( a // `b` , a % b ) .

Clear some cookies . If given a single argument , only cookies belonging to that `domain` will be removed . If given two arguments , cookies belonging to the specified domain and URL `path` are removed .
List a directory in a standardized format by using MLSD command ( RFC 3659 ) . If `path` is omitted the current directory is assumed .

snippet: sqlite3.connect(database, timeout, detect_types, isolation_level, check_same_thread, factory, cached_statements)
intent: Opens a connection to the SQLite `database` file database . The `timeout` parameter specifies how long the connection should wait for the lock to go away until raising an exception . The `detect_types` parameter and the using custom converters registered with the module-level register_converter ( ) function allow you to easily do that . For the `isolation_level` parameter , please see the isolation_level property of Connection objects . By default , `check_same_thread` is True and only the creating thread may use the connection . By default returns a Connection object , unless a custom `factory` is given . If you want to explicitly set the number of statements that are cached for the connection , you can set the `cached_statements` parameter .
Set the process group associated with the terminal given by `fd` ( an open file descriptor as returned by os.open ( ) ) to `pg` .

Return a list of the best “ good enough ” matches . `word` is a sequence for which close matches are desired ( typically a string ) , and `possibilities` is a list of sequences against which to match word ( typically a list of strings ) . Optional argument `n` ( default 3 ) is the maximum number of close matches to return ; n must be greater than 0 .
Finds the first subelement matching `match` .
Raised when a system function timed out at the system level.
Seek to the specified frame number . With arguments `pos`.
Like assertRaises ( ) but also tests that `regex` matches on the string representation of the raised `exception` .
Seek to the specified frame number . With arguments `pos`.
Specialized version of sendmsg ( ) for AF_ALG socket . With arguments `msg`, `op`, `iv`.

Extract cookies from HTTP `response` and store them in the CookieJar , where allowed by policy . The `request` object ( usually a urllib.request.Request instance ) must support the methods get_full_url ( ) , get_host ( ) , unverifiable ( ) , and origin_req_host attribute , as documented by urllib.request .
Return the string obtained by doing backslash substitution on the `template` string template , as done by the sub ( ) method .

This method makes a backup of a SQLite database even while it ’ s being accessed by other clients , or concurrently by the same connection . The copy will be written into the mandatory argument `target` , that must be another Connection instance . By default , or when `pages` is either 0 or a negative integer , the entire database is copied in a single step ; otherwise the method performs a loop copying up to pages pages at a time . The `sleep` argument specifies the number of seconds to sleep by between successive attempts to backup remaining pages , can be specified either as an integer or a floating point value .

Returns a new ChainMap containing a new map followed by all of the maps in the current instance . If `m` is specified , it becomes the new map at the front of the list of mappings ; if not specified , an empty dict is used , so that a call to d.new_child ( ) is equivalent to : ChainMap ( { } , *d.maps ) .
Called by the parser to give the application a `locator` for locating the origin of document events .
Convert an integer number to a lowercase hexadecimal string prefixed with “ 0x ” . If `x` is not a Python int object , it has to define an __index__ ( ) method that returns an integer .
Display a horizontal line starting at ( `y` , `x` ) with length `n` consisting of the character `ch` .
As with the normal socket object , `address` is a tuple with the first element the host to connect to , and the second the port number .

This method sorts the list in place , using only < comparisons between items . `key` specifies a function of one argument that is used to extract a comparison key from each list element ( for example , key=str.lower ) . `reverse` is a boolean value .
Set the extended filesystem `attribute` attribute on `path` to `value` .

A convenience wrapper for warnings.catch_warnings ( ) that makes it easier to test that a warning was correctly raised . If one or more filters are provided , or if the optional keyword argument `quiet` is False , it checks to make sure the warnings are as expected : each specified filter must match at least one of the warnings raised by the enclosed code or the test fails , and if any warnings are raised that do not match any of the specified filters the test fails . With arguments `*filters`.
Adds a new tab to the notebook . With arguments `child`, `**kw`.
Closely emulate the behavior of the interactive Python interpreter . With arguments `filename`.
Mock objects limit the results of dir ( some_mock ) to useful results .
Formats a number `val` according to the current LC_NUMERIC setting . The `format` follows the conventions of the % operator . If `grouping` is true , also takes the grouping into account .
If the `prompt` argument is present , it is written to standard output without a trailing newline .
Return false if cookies should not be returned , given cookie `path` . With arguments `request`.

Recursively descend the directory tree named by `dir` , compiling all .py files along the way . If `quiet` is False or 0 ( the default ) , the filenames and other information are printed to standard out .
Connect to a `host` on a given `port` .
Insert an entry into the list of warnings filter specifications . With arguments `action`, `category`.

Test that `first` and `second` are approximately ( or not approximately ) equal by computing the difference , rounding to the given number of decimal `places` ( default 7 ) , and comparing to zero . If `delta` is supplied instead of places then the difference between first and second must be less or equal to ( or greater than ) delta .

Construct a PrettyPrinter instance . The amount of indentation added for each recursive level is specified by `indent` ; the default is one . The desired output `width` is constrained using the width parameter ; the default is 80 characters .

Issue a warning , or maybe ignore it or raise an exception . Alternatively `message` can be a Warning instance , in which case category will be ignored and message.__class__ will be used . The `stacklevel` argument can be used by wrapper functions written in Python , like this :
Decompress `data` ( a bytes-like object ) , returning uncompressed data as bytes . If `max_length` is nonnegative , returns at most max_length bytes of decompressed data .
Default loader . `href` is a URL . `parse` is for parse mode either “ xml ” or “ text ” .
List a directory in a standardized format by using MLSD command ( RFC 3659 ) . If `path` is omitted the current directory is assumed .

Recursively copy an entire directory tree rooted at `src` , returning the destination directory . The destination directory , named by `dst` , must not already exist ; it will be created as well as missing parent directories . If `copy_function` is given , it must be a callable that will be used to copy each file .

The main configuration parser . When `strict` is True ( the default ) , the parser won ’ t allow for any section or option duplicates while reading from a single source ( file , string or dictionary ) , raising DuplicateSectionError or DuplicateOptionError . With arguments `':')`, `';')`.
A helper function to indicate a distinct types to a typechecker , see NewType . With arguments `typ`.
With no arguments , run a full collection . The optional argument `generation` may be an integer specifying which generation to collect ( from 0 to 2 ) .
These methods immediately delete the message . With arguments `key`.
If a formatter is specified , it is used to format the `record` .
Reads `size` bytes from the remote server .

Test examples associated with object `f` ; for example , f may be a string , a module , a function , or a class object . A shallow copy of dictionary argument `globs` is used for the execution context . Optional argument `optionflags` works as for function testfile ( ) above .
Read exactly `n` bytes .
Adds the element `subelement` to the end of this element ’ s internal list of subelements .
Test x for membership in s.

This method makes a backup of a SQLite database even while it ’ s being accessed by other clients , or concurrently by the same connection . The copy will be written into the mandatory argument `target` , that must be another Connection instance . The `sleep` argument specifies the number of seconds to sleep by between successive attempts to backup remaining pages , can be specified either as an integer or a floating point value .
A class to handle HTTP Cookies . With arguments `cookiejar`.

Join one or more `path` components intelligently . The return value is the concatenation of path and any members of `*paths` with exactly one directory separator ( os.sep ) following each non-empty part except the last , meaning that the result will only end in a separator if the last part is empty .
If `rawdata` is a string , parse it as an HTTP_COOKIE and add the values found there as Morsels .
This iterates over all the subparts of `msg` , returning only those subparts that match the MIME type specified by `maintype` and `subtype` .

Construct a PrettyPrinter instance . The amount of indentation added for each recursive level is specified by `indent` ; the default is one . The number of levels which may be printed is controlled by `depth` ; if the data structure being printed is too deep , the next contained level is replaced by ... . By default , there is no constraint on the depth of the objects being formatted .
Returns the `day` of the week ( 0 is Monday ) for `year` ( 1970–… ) , `month` ( 1–12 ) , day ( 1–31 ) .
Add a mapping from the MIME `type` type to the extension `ext` .
Return an instance of a dict subclass that has methods specialized for rearranging dictionary order . With arguments `items`.
This function handles the exception described by `info` ( a 3-tuple containing the result of sys.exc_info ( ) ) , formatting its traceback as text and returning the result as a string .

Flushes changes made to the in-memory copy of a file back to disk . If `offset` and `size` are specified , only changes to the given range of bytes will be flushed to disk ; otherwise , the whole extent of the mapping is flushed .

A Cmd instance or subclass instance is a line-oriented interpreter framework . The optional arguments `stdin` and `stdout` specify the input and output file objects that the Cmd instance or subclass instance will use for input and output .
Adds the specified handler `hdlr` to this logger .

This function is invoked by the import statement . The function imports the module `name` , potentially using the given `globals` and `locals` to determine how to interpret the name in a package context . `level` specifies whether to use absolute or relative imports .
A positive integer specifying the number of elements in the array.
Add a `callback` to be run when the Future is done .
Move an existing `key` to either end of an ordered dictionary . The item is moved to the right end if `last` is true ( the default ) or to the beginning if last is false .
Insert a new item with value `x` in the array before position `i` .
Decorator to wrap a function with a memoizing callable that saves up to the `maxsize` most recent calls .

Returns a new ChainMap containing a new map followed by all of the maps in the current instance . If `m` is specified , it becomes the new map at the front of the list of mappings ; if not specified , an empty dict is used , so that a call to d.new_child ( ) is equivalent to : ChainMap ( { } , *d.maps ) .
Return a str version of `object` .
Checks for an ASCII alphanumeric character ; it is equivalent to isalpha ( `c` ) or isdigit ( c ) .
Draw a circular dot with diameter `size` , using color . With arguments `*color`.
Run the specified WSGI application , `app` .

Encodes `object` ( taking the current state of the encoder into account ) and returns the resulting encoded object . If this is the last call to encode ( ) `final` must be true ( the default is false ) .
Return a new set object , optionally with elements taken from `iterable` .
Convert sound fragments in a-LAW encoding to linearly encoded sound fragments . a-LAW encoding always uses 8 bits samples , so `width` refers only to the sample width of the output `fragment` here .

This function is useful for programs that want to emulate Python ’ s interpreter main loop ( a.k.a . `source` is the source string ; `filename` is the optional filename from which source was read , defaulting to ' < input > ' ; and `symbol` is the optional grammar start symbol , which should be either 'single ' ( the default ) or 'eval ' .
Finds the first subelement matching `match` .

Returns the list of directories that will be searched for a named executable , similar to a shell , when launching a process . `env` , when specified , should be an environment variable dictionary to lookup the PATH in .
Insert a new item with value `x` in the array before position `i` .
Reads the logging configuration from a configparser-format file . With arguments `fname`.
Implement this method in a subclass such that it returns a serializable object for `o` , or calls the base implementation ( to raise a TypeError ) .
Print exception information and stack trace entries from traceback object `tb` to `file` . With arguments `etype`, `value`.

This function operates exactly as TemporaryFile ( ) does , except that data is spooled in memory until the file size exceeds `max_size` , or until the file ’ s fileno ( ) method is called , at which point the contents are written to disk and operation proceeds as with TemporaryFile ( ) . The returned object is a file-like object whose _file attribute is either an io.BytesIO or io.StringIO object ( depending on whether binary or text `mode` was specified ) or a true file object , depending on whether rollover ( ) has been called .
Return a string representing the date , controlled by an explicit `format` string .

This function handles the exception described by `info` ( a 3-tuple containing the result of sys.exc_info ( ) ) , formatting its traceback as text and returning the result as a string . The optional argument `context` is the number of lines of context to display around the current line of source code in the traceback ; this defaults to 5 .

For existing code calling readfp ( ) with arguments which don ’ t support iteration , the following generator may be used as a wrapper around the file-like object : Instead of parser.readfp ( `fp` ) use parser.read_file ( readline_generator ( fp ) ) . With arguments `filename`.
Run the examples in `test` ( a DocTest object ) , and display the results using the writer function `out` .
Transform a method into a class method.
Return True if all elements of the `iterable` are true ( or if the iterable is empty ) .
Decorator for __repr__ ( ) methods to detect recursive calls within the same thread . If a recursive call is made , the `fillvalue` is returned , otherwise , the usual __repr__ ( ) call is made .
Insert an entry into the list of warnings filter specifications . With arguments `action`.
Find longest matching block in a [ `alo` : `ahi` ] and b [ `blo` : `bhi` ] .
Return True if d has a key key, else False.

Generate the file names in a directory tree by walking the tree either top-down or bottom-up . For each directory in the tree rooted at directory `top` ( including top itself ) , it yields a 3-tuple ( dirpath , dirnames , filenames ) .
Reload a previously imported `module` .
All arguments are optional and default to 0 . With arguments `hours`.
Join a `thread` within `timeout` .

snippet: window.border(ls, rs, ts, bs, tl, tr, bl, br)
intent: Draw a border around the edges of the window . With arguments `ls`, `rs`, `ts`, `bs`, `tl`, `tr`, `bl`, `br`.
Creates a new object of the same type of `instance` , replacing fields with values from changes . With arguments `**changes`.
Generates a string representation of an XML `element` , including all subelements . `method` is either `` xml '' , `` html '' or `` text '' ( default is `` xml '' ) .

Call the underlying PlaySound ( ) function from the Platform API . The `sound` parameter may be a filename , a system sound alias , audio data as a bytes-like object , or None . Outputs a symbolic disassembly of the `pickle` to the file-like object `out` , defaulting to sys.stdout . Successive levels , indicated by MARK opcodes in the stream , are indented by `indentlevel` spaces .
With no arguments , run a full collection . The optional argument `generation` may be an integer specifying which generation to collect ( from 0 to 2 ) .
Set the current numeric umask and return the previous umask . With arguments `mask`.

Returns a new ChainMap containing a new map followed by all of the maps in the current instance . If `m` is specified , it becomes the new map at the front of the list of mappings ; if not specified , an empty dict is used , so that a call to d.new_child ( ) is equivalent to : ChainMap ( { } , *d.maps ) .
Run the given subprocess.Popen process until completion and return stdout . With arguments `p`.
Called for the start of every element . `name` is a string containing the element name , and `attributes` is the element attributes .

Tests the image data contained in the file named by `filename` , and returns a string describing the image type . If optional `h` is provided , the filename is ignored and h is assumed to contain the byte stream to test .
Set the maximum depth of the Python interpreter stack to `limit` .

Returns a new instance of the HTTPHandler class . The `host` can be of the form host : port , should you need to use a specific port number . If no `method` is specified , GET is used . If `secure` is true , a HTTPS connection will be used . With arguments `url`.
Loader that wraps Python ’ s “ classic ” import algorithm . With arguments `fullname`, `file`, `filename`, `etc`.
Disassemble the `x` object .
Abstract base class for arrays . With arguments `*args`.
Set the main `type` and subtype for the Content-Type `header` .
Return a Boolean value , i.e .
Subclass of ValueError with the following additional attributes : With arguments `msg`, `doc`, `pos`.
The `year` , `month` and `day` arguments are required . With arguments `hour`, `minute`.

Make an iterator that returns evenly spaced values starting with number `start` . When counting with floating point numbers , better accuracy can sometimes be achieved by substituting multiplicative code such as : ( start + `step` * i for i in count ( ) ) .
Returns the logarithm of `x` to the given `base` .
Set the main `type` and subtype for the Content-Type `header` .
For a time t , str ( t ) is equivalent to t.isoformat ( ) .
Add a mark with the given `id` ( larger than 0 ) , and the given `name` at the given position . With arguments `pos`.
Given the address `addr` of an SSL-protected server , as a ( hostname , port-number ) pair , fetches the server ’ s certificate , and returns it as a PEM-encoded string .
Return a slice object representing the set of indices specified by range ( start , `stop` , step ) .

A buffer providing higher-level access to a readable , sequential RawIOBase object . When reading data from this object , a larger amount of data may be requested from the underlying `raw` stream , and kept in an internal buffer .

Decode the Ascii85 encoded bytes-like object or ASCII string `b` and return the decoded bytes . `ignorechars` should be a bytes-like object or ASCII string containing characters to ignore from the input .
Equivalent to not key in d.
Locates an image file of the `name` name.xpm , name.xbm or name.ppm in one of the bitmap directories ( see the tix_addbitmapdir ( ) method above ) . With arguments `self`.
Add a `director` as parent .
Join a `thread` within `timeout` .
Returns the lowest index in the object where the subsequence `sub` is found , such that sub is contained in the range [ `start` , `end` ] .
Set the maximum depth of the Python interpreter stack to `limit` .
This is a subclass derived from IMAP4 that connects to the stdin/stdout file descriptors created by passing `command` to subprocess.Popen ( ) .
Lock program segments into memory . The value of `op` ( defined in < sys/lock.h > ) determines which segments are locked .
Return an iterator for the `month` month ( 1–12 ) in the `year` year .
Return a m-column calendar for an entire year as a multi-line string . With arguments `theyear`, `m`.
Close currently selected mailbox .
If `selop` is not specified , returns selected `items` .
Raised when the import statement has troubles trying to load a module.
Return the position of `x` in the deque ( at or after index `start` and before index `stop` ) .
Returns an instance of LoggerAdapter initialized with an underlying Logger instance and a dict-like object . With arguments `logger`, `extra`.
Convert the color from RGB coordinates to YIQ coordinates . With arguments `r`, `g`, `b`.
Parse configuration data from a `string` . Optional argument `source` specifies a context-specific name of the string passed .
Open the URL `url` , which can be either a string or a Request object . `data` must be an object specifying additional data to be sent to the server , or None if no such data is needed .
Add an entry to the Component table , and make this `component` the current component for this directory . With arguments `uuid`.

Return a new sorted list from the items in `iterable` . `key` specifies a function of one argument that is used to extract a comparison key from each element in iterable ( for example , key=str.lower ) . `reverse` is a boolean value .
Byte-compile all the .py files found along sys.path . With arguments `quiet`.

Return the payload of the part as either a string ( for text parts ) , an EmailMessage object ( for message/rfc822 parts ) , or a bytes object ( for all other non-multipart types ) . With arguments `msg`.
Decorator to wrap a function with a memoizing callable that saves up to the `maxsize` most recent calls .
Return True if all elements of the `iterable` are true ( or if the iterable is empty ) .

Call the underlying PlaySound ( ) function from the Platform API . The `sound` parameter may be a filename , a system sound alias , audio data as a bytes-like object , or None . Its interpretation depends on the value of `flags` , which can be a bitwise ORed combination of the constants described below .
Each concrete class has an attribute _fields which gives the names of all child nodes.
Return a floating point number constructed from a number or string `x` .

Return a 2-tuple ; the first element is a string containing the command line to be executed ( which can be passed to os.system ( ) ) , and the second element is the mailcap entry for a given MIME type . `key` is the name of the field desired , which represents the type of activity to be performed ; the default value is ‘ view ’ , since in the most common case you simply want to view the body of the MIME-typed data . With arguments `caps`.
Specify the compression `type` . The `name` parameter should be a human-readable description of the compression type as a bytes array , the type parameter should be a bytes array of length 4 .

Creates or opens the specified `key` , returning a handle object . `sub_key` is a string that names the key this method opens or creates . `access` is an integer that specifies an access mask that describes the desired security access for the key .
Outputs a symbolic disassembly of the `pickle` to the file-like object `out` , defaulting to sys.stdout .

Get additional `version` information from the Windows Registry and return a tuple ( `release` , version , `csd` , `ptype` ) referring to OS release , version number , CSD level ( service pack ) and OS type ( multi/single processor ) .

A buffered I/O object combining two unidirectional RawIOBase objects – one readable , the other writeable – into a single bidirectional endpoint . `reader` and `writer` are RawIOBase objects that are readable and writeable respectively .
Return a `k` length list of unique elements chosen from the `population` sequence or set .
Return a date with the same value , except for those parameters given new values by whichever keyword arguments are specified . With arguments `day`.

Returns a new instance of the TimedRotatingFileHandler class . On rotating it also sets the `filename` suffix . If the `utc` argument is true , times in UTC will be used ; otherwise local time is used .
The Bdb class acts as a generic Python debugger base class . The `skip` argument , if given , must be an iterable of glob-style module name patterns .

Execute the program path in a new process . If `mode` is P_NOWAIT , this function returns the process id of the new process ; if mode is P_WAIT , returns the process ’ s exit code if it exits normally , or -signal , where signal is the signal that killed the process . The variants which include a second “ p ” near the end ( spawnlp ( ) , spawnlpe ( ) , spawnvp ( ) , and spawnvpe ( ) ) will use the PATH environment variable to locate the program `file` .
Spawn a process , and connect its controlling terminal with the current process ’ s standard io . With arguments `argv`.
Reads the logging configuration from a configparser-format file . With arguments `fname`, `disable_existing_loggers`.
Set the scrolling region from line `top` to line `bottom` .
Run the command described by `args` . With arguments `cwd`.
Assert that `iter` is deallocated after iterating . With arguments `test`, `cls`.
Set the line-end translation mode for the file descriptor `fd` . To set it to text mode , `flags` should be os.O_TEXT ; for binary , it should be os.O_BINARY .

A buffer providing higher-level access to a readable , sequential RawIOBase object . When reading data from this object , a larger amount of data may be requested from the underlying `raw` stream , and kept in an internal buffer .
Return True if the context has a value for var set; return False otherwise.
Establish a network connection and return a pair of ( reader , writer ) objects . With arguments `family`.
Register the read end of `pipe` in the event loop . `protocol_factory` must be a callable returning an asyncio protocol implementation .
Set `loop` as a current event loop for the current OS thread .
Join a `thread` within `timeout` .
Select a `mailbox` .
Lock program segments into memory . The value of `op` ( defined in < sys/lock.h > ) determines which segments are locked .
Called once for each element type declaration . `name` is the name of the element type , and `model` is a representation of the content model .

Outputs a symbolic disassembly of the `pickle` to the file-like object `out` , defaulting to sys.stdout . Successive levels , indicated by MARK opcodes in the stream , are indented by `indentlevel` spaces .
Returns a 3-column calendar for an entire `year` as a multi-line string using the formatyear ( ) of the TextCalendar class . With arguments `l`, `m`.
Create an object to `trace` execution of a single statement or expression .

This function implements the standard .mo file search algorithm . It takes a `domain` , identical to what textdomain ( ) takes . If `all` is given , it returns a list of all file names , in the order in which they appear in the languages list or the environment variables .
Compose a raw device number from the `major` and `minor` device numbers .

intent: Add a radio button named `name` to the group , at the coordinates `x` , `y` , `width` , `height` , and with the label `text` .
Adds a new tab to the notebook . With arguments `child`, `**kw`.

Legacy variant of the ConfigParser . It has `interpolation` disabled by default and allows for non-string section names , option names , and values via its unsafe add_section and set methods , as well as the legacy defaults= keyword argument handling . With arguments `':')`, `';')`.
Unpack from `buffer` starting at position `offset` , according to the `format` string format .

Return a new sorted list from the items in `iterable` . `key` specifies a function of one argument that is used to extract a comparison key from each element in iterable ( for example , key=str.lower ) .

Return the docstring of the given `node` ( which must be a FunctionDef , AsyncFunctionDef , ClassDef , or Module node ) , or None if it has no docstring . If `clean` is true , clean up the docstring ’ s indentation with inspect.cleandoc ( ) .

Compresses the bytes in `data` , returning a bytes object containing compressed data . `level` is an integer from 0 to 9 or -1 controlling the level of compression ; 1 ( Z_BEST_SPEED ) is fastest and produces the least compression , 9 ( Z_BEST_COMPRESSION ) is slowest and produces the most .
All following arguments are optional and can be accessed as instance attributes as well . The `tarinfo` argument can be used to replace the default TarInfo class with a different one .
Receive notification of character data . `content` may be a string or bytes instance ; the expat reader module always produces strings .
Define how a single command-line argument should be parsed . With arguments `name or flags...`.

Return a m-column calendar for an entire year as a multi-line string . Optional parameters `w` , `l` , and `c` are for date column width , lines per week , and number of spaces between month columns , respectively . With arguments `theyear`.

Authenticate command — requires response processing . `mechanism` specifies which authentication mechanism is to be used - it should appear in the instance variable capabilities in the form AUTH=mechanism . `authobject` must be a callable object :
With one argument , returns a dictionary of column/value pairs for the specified `item` . With two arguments , returns the current `value` of the specified `column` .
If the `prompt` argument is present , it is written to standard output without a trailing newline .
Equivalent to not key in d.

Temporarily sets the current theme to `themename` , apply specified `settings` and then restore the previous theme .
Return a new set object , optionally with elements taken from `iterable` .
Create a Stats object based on the current profile and print the results to stdout . With arguments `sort`.
Set the list of supplemental group ids associated with the current process to `groups` .
Return data for response `code` if received , or None .
Send user command , response should indicate that a password is required . With arguments `username`.
Identical to the split ( ) function , using the compiled pattern . With arguments `string`, `maxsplit`.
Return the absolute value of a number . With arguments `x`.

Packs a fixed length list ( `array` ) of homogeneous items . `n` is the length of the list ; it is not packed into the buffer , but a ValueError exception is raised if len ( array ) is not equal to n. As above , `pack_item` is the function used to pack each element .

Gaussian distribution . `mu` is the mean , and `sigma` is the standard deviation .

Encodes `object` ( taking the current state of the encoder into account ) and returns the resulting encoded object . If this is the last call to encode ( ) `final` must be true ( the default is false ) .

A processing class used to extract the DocTests that are relevant to a given object , from its docstring and the docstrings of its contained objects . The optional argument `parser` specifies the DocTestParser object ( or a drop-in replacement ) that is used to extract doctests from docstrings . If the optional argument `recurse` is false , then DocTestFinder.find ( ) will only examine the given object , and not any contained objects .

Return an estimated length for the object o . First try to return its actual length , then an estimate using object.__length_hint__ ( ) , and finally return the `default` value . With arguments `obj`.
Create a new ArgumentParser object . Each parameter has its own more detailed `description` below , but in short they are :
Add a header to the message with field `name` name and value `val` .
Convert sound fragments in a-LAW encoding to linearly encoded sound fragments . a-LAW encoding always uses 8 bits samples , so `width` refers only to the sample width of the output `fragment` here .
Called when the buffer was updated with the received data . `nbytes` is the total number of bytes that were written to the buffer .
Returns an instance of LoggerAdapter initialized with an underlying Logger instance and a dict-like object . With arguments `logger`, `extra`.

Open an LZMA-compressed file in binary or text `mode` , returning a file object . The `filename` argument can be either an actual file name ( given as a str , bytes or path-like object ) , in which case the named file is opened , or it can be an existing file object to read from or write to . In this case , the `check` and `preset` arguments should not be used .
Define how a single command-line argument should be parsed . With arguments `name or flags...`.

This exception is raised when a system function returns a system-related error , including I/O failures such as “ file not found ” or “ disk full ” ( not for illegal argument types or other incidental errors ) .

This function causes the cgitb module to take over the interpreter ’ s default handling for exceptions by setting the value of sys.excepthook . The optional argument `context` is the number of lines of context to display around the current line of source code in the traceback ; this defaults to 5 .
If `flag` is True , allow 8-bit characters to be input .
Class that simulates a string object . The instance ’ s contents are initially set to a copy of `seq` .
Return a list of file names as returned by the NLST command . The optional `argument` is a directory to list ( default is the current server directory ) .
Connect to a `host` on a given `port` .
Opens socket to `port` at `host` .
Context manager to start `threads` .
A first in , first out ( FIFO ) queue . If `maxsize` is less than or equal to zero , the queue size is infinite .
Report that the `test` runner is about to process the given `example` . `out` is the output function that was passed to DocTestRunner.run ( ) .
Return the number of the color-pair set by the attribute value `attr` .

A Cmd instance or subclass instance is a line-oriented interpreter framework . The optional arguments `stdin` and `stdout` specify the input and output file objects that the Cmd instance or subclass instance will use for input and output .

Returns a compression object , to be used for compressing data streams that won ’ t fit into memory at once . `level` is the compression level – an integer from 0 to 9 or -1 . `strategy` is used to tune the compression algorithm .
This exception is raised by the sys.exit() function.
Write coverage results . Set `summary` to include in the output the coverage summary per module .
If the `prompt` argument is present , it is written to standard output without a trailing newline .

Return a m-column calendar for an entire year as a multi-line string . Optional parameters `w` , `l` , and `c` are for date column width , lines per week , and number of spaces between month columns , respectively . With arguments `theyear`.
Construct a PrettyPrinter instance . The desired output `width` is constrained using the width parameter ; the default is 80 characters .
This read-only attribute returns the callback currently associated to the weakref.

A command-line program that loads a set of tests from `module` and runs them ; this is primarily for making test modules conveniently executable . The `defaultTest` argument is either the name of a single test or an iterable of test names to run if no test names are specified via `argv` .
Perform the operation `cmd` on file descriptor `fd` ( file objects providing a fileno ( ) method are accepted as well ) . The argument `arg` can either be an integer value , or a bytes object .
This function handles the exception described by `info` ( a 3-tuple containing the result of sys.exc_info ( ) ) , formatting its traceback as text and returning the result as a string .
Retrieve attributes without triggering dynamic lookup via the descriptor protocol , __getattr__ ( ) or __getattribute__ ( ) . With arguments `obj`, `attr`, `default`.
For a datetime instance d , str ( d ) is equivalent to d.isoformat ( ' ' ) .

Return a dictionary mapping module-level class names to class descriptors . Parameter `module` is a string with the name of the module to read ; it may be the name of a module within a package . If given , `path` is a sequence of directory paths prepended to sys.path , which is used to locate the module source code .

Open `file` and return a corresponding file object . `mode` is an optional string that specifies the mode in which the file is opened . `buffering` is an optional integer used to set the buffering policy .
Send user command , response should indicate that a password is required . With arguments `username`.

Many programs split up their functionality into a number of sub-commands , for example , the svn program can invoke sub-commands like svn checkout , svn update , and svn commit . The add_subparsers ( ) method also supports `title` and `description` keyword arguments .
This is identical to m.group ( `g` ) .
Return the length ( the number of items ) of an object . With arguments `s`.
Return the __dict__ attribute for a module , class , instance , or any other `object` with a __dict__ attribute .
This is identical to m.group ( `g` ) .

Compile the `source` into a code or AST object . The `filename` argument should give the file from which the code was read ; pass some recognizable value if it wasn ’ t read from a file ( ' < string > ' is commonly used ) . The `mode` argument specifies what kind of code must be compiled ; it can be 'exec ' if source consists of a sequence of statements , 'eval ' if it consists of a single expression , or 'single ' if it consists of a single interactive statement ( in the latter case , expression statements that evaluate to something other than None will be printed ) . The optional arguments `flags` and `dont_inherit` control which future statements affect the compilation of source .
Reads `size` bytes from the remote server .
Make an entry into the EventMapping table for this control . With arguments `event`, `attribute`.
A decorator to conditionally mark tests with unittest.expectedFailure ( ) . With arguments `condition`.

Convert the characters ' & ' , ' < ' and ' > ' in string `s` to HTML-safe sequences . If the optional flag `quote` is true , the quotation mark character ( `` ) is also translated ; this helps for inclusion in an HTML attribute value delimited by double quotes , as in < a href= '' ... '' > .
Write `data` to the output file .

The arguments are a string and optional `globals` and `locals` . The `expression` argument is parsed and evaluated as a Python expression ( technically speaking , a condition list ) using the globals and locals dictionaries as global and local namespace .
Return the largest item in an iterable or the largest of two or more arguments . With arguments `arg1`, `arg2`, `*args`.

Set the current position of file descriptor `fd` to position `pos` , modified by `how` : SEEK_SET or 0 to set the position relative to the beginning of the file ; SEEK_CUR or 1 to set it relative to the current position ; SEEK_END or 2 to set it relative to the end of the file .
Print exception information and stack trace entries from traceback object `tb` to `file` . With arguments `etype`, `value`.
Sets the terminating condition to be recognized on the channel . `term` may be any of three types of value , corresponding to three different ways to handle incoming protocol data .
Without arguments , return the list of names in the current local scope .
IMAP4 server errors cause this exception to be raised.
Extract a `member` from the archive to the current working directory , using its full name .

This method makes a backup of a SQLite database even while it ’ s being accessed by other clients , or concurrently by the same connection . The copy will be written into the mandatory argument `target` , that must be another Connection instance . The `sleep` argument specifies the number of seconds to sleep by between successive attempts to backup remaining pages , can be specified either as an integer or a floating point value .
Rather than being a function , range is actually an immutable sequence type , as documented in Ranges and Sequence Types — list , tuple , range . With arguments `start`, `stop`, `step`.

Returns a new instance of the QueueListener class . The instance is initialized with the `queue` to send messages to and a list of handlers which will handle entries placed on the queue . With arguments `*handlers`.
Send a `file` over a `transport` . `offset` tells from where to start reading the file .
Encode a message header into an RFC-compliant format , possibly wrapping long lines and encapsulating non-ASCII parts in base64 or quoted-printable encodings . With arguments `\t'`.
Append a new item with value `x` to the end of the array .
Return the stateth completion for `text` . With arguments `state`.

Create a Timer instance with the given statement , `setup` code and `timer` function and run its timeit ( ) method with `number` executions . The optional `globals` argument specifies a namespace in which to execute the code .
Temporarily unset the environment variable `envvar` .

Open an LZMA-compressed file in binary or text `mode` , returning a file object . The `filename` argument can be either an actual file name ( given as a str , bytes or path-like object ) , in which case the named file is opened , or it can be an existing file object to read from or write to . When opening a file for reading , the `format` and `filters` arguments have the same meanings as for LZMADecompressor .

Version interface for Jython . Returns a tuple ( `release` , `vendor` , `vminfo` , `osinfo` ) with vminfo being a tuple ( vm_name , vm_release , vm_vendor ) and osinfo being a tuple ( os_name , os_version , os_arch ) . With arguments `''`, `'')`, `''`, `'')`.

Generate the file names in a directory tree by walking the tree either top-down or bottom-up . For each directory in the tree rooted at directory `top` ( including top itself ) , it yields a 3-tuple ( dirpath , dirnames , filenames ) . Set `followlinks` to True to visit directories pointed to by symlinks , on systems that support them .
Context manager to check that no ResourceWarning was raised . With arguments `testcase`.
Closely emulate the behavior of the interactive Python interpreter . With arguments `filename`.
Return an integer object constructed from a number or string `x` , or return 0 if no arguments are given .
Set the size and position of the main window . With arguments `width`.

Similar to waitpid ( ) , except no process id argument is given and a 3-element tuple containing the child ’ s process id , exit status indication , and resource usage information is returned . With arguments `options`.
Move the turtle forward by the specified `distance` , in the direction the turtle is headed .
An implementation of the built-in __import__ ( ) function . With arguments `name`.

Construct a PrettyPrinter instance . The amount of indentation added for each recursive level is specified by `indent` ; the default is one . The number of levels which may be printed is controlled by `depth` ; if the data structure being printed is too deep , the next contained level is replaced by ... . By default , there is no constraint on the depth of the objects being formatted .
Return `n` independent iterators from a single `iterable` .
Return a datetime with the same attributes , except for those attributes given new values by whichever keyword arguments are specified . With arguments `hour`.

This method makes a backup of a SQLite database even while it ’ s being accessed by other clients , or concurrently by the same connection . The copy will be written into the mandatory argument `target` , that must be another Connection instance . By default , or when `pages` is either 0 or a negative integer , the entire database is copied in a single step ; otherwise the method performs a loop copying up to pages pages at a time .
Return a list of file names as returned by the NLST command . The optional `argument` is a directory to list ( default is the current server directory ) .
Read `n` items ( as machine values ) from the file object `f` and append them to the end of the array .

Execute a child program in a new process . `args` should be a sequence of program arguments or else a single string . If `close_fds` is true , all file descriptors except 0 , 1 and 2 will be closed before the child process is executed .
Create an instance of the FileInput class . With arguments `files`.

Return a new set with elements from the set and all others . With arguments `*others`.

Return a file-like object that can be used as a temporary storage area . The `mode` parameter defaults to ' w+b ' so that the file created can be read and written without being closed . `buffering` , `encoding` and `newline` are interpreted as for open ( ) .
Decorator to wrap a function with a memoizing callable that saves up to the `maxsize` most recent calls . If `typed` is set to true , function arguments of different types will be cached separately .
Formats a number `val` according to the current LC_NUMERIC setting . The `format` follows the conventions of the % operator .
Return a context manager that will set the current context for the active thread to a copy of `ctx` on entry to the with-statement and restore the previous context when exiting the with-statement .

All arguments are optional and default to 0 . With arguments `hours`.

This method makes a backup of a SQLite database even while it ’ s being accessed by other clients , or concurrently by the same connection . The copy will be written into the mandatory argument `target` , that must be another Connection instance . The `sleep` argument specifies the number of seconds to sleep by between successive attempts to backup remaining pages , can be specified either as an integer or a floating point value .
Test x for non-membership in s.

Run the examples in `test` ( a DocTest object ) , and display the results using the writer function `out` .

Convert a mapping object or a sequence of two-element tuples , which may contain str or bytes objects , to a percent-encoded ASCII text string . When a sequence of two-element tuples is used as the `query` argument , the first element of each tuple is a key and the second is a value .
Set maximum number of cached connections to `m` .

Disassemble the `x` object . The disassembly is written as text to the supplied `file` argument if provided and to sys.stdout otherwise . The maximal `depth` of recursion is limited by depth unless it is None .
Base class for warnings about deprecated features when those warnings are intended for other Python developers.
Set the scrolling region from line `top` to line `bottom` .
( Windows version ) Maps `length` bytes from the file specified by the file handle `fileno` , and creates a mmap object . With arguments `access`.
Maps a logging level name to a syslog priority name . With arguments `levelname`.
Optional argument `isjunk` must be None ( the default ) or `a` one-argument function that takes a sequence element and returns true if and only if the element is “ junk ” and should be ignored .

Version interface for Jython . Returns a tuple ( `release` , `vendor` , `vminfo` , `osinfo` ) with vminfo being a tuple ( vm_name , vm_release , vm_vendor ) and osinfo being a tuple ( os_name , os_version , os_arch ) . With arguments `''`, `'')`, `''`, `'')`.
Append a new item with value `x` to the end of the array .
