This class implements the ContentHandler interface by writing SAX events back into an XML document . `encoding` is the encoding of the output stream which defaults to 'iso-8859-1 ' .

This class is an abstraction of a URL request . `url` should be a string containing a valid URL . If no Content-Length nor Transfer-Encoding header field has been provided , HTTPHandler will set these `headers` according to the type of data .
Print objects to the text stream `file` , separated by `sep` and followed by `end` . With arguments `*objects`.
Codec details when looking up the codec registry . With arguments `encode`, `decode`.

Similar to waitpid ( ) , except no process id argument is given and a 3-element tuple containing the child ’ s process id , exit status indication , and resource usage information is returned . With arguments `options`.
Return the string obtained by doing backslash substitution on the `template` string template , as done by the sub ( ) method .
This class method constructs a Fraction representing the exact value of `dec` , which must be a decimal.Decimal instance .
Without arguments , return the list of names in the current local scope .

When a header parameter is encoded in RFC 2231 format , Message.get_param may return a 3-tuple containing the character set , language , and `value` . Optional `fallback_charset` specifies the character set to use if the one in the RFC 2231 header is not known by Python ; it defaults to 'us-ascii ' .
Wraps the single paragraph in `text` ( a string ) so every line is at most `width` characters long . With arguments `**kwargs`.

This function causes the cgitb module to take over the interpreter ’ s default handling for exceptions by setting the value of sys.excepthook . The optional argument `context` is the number of lines of context to display around the current line of source code in the traceback ; this defaults to 5 .
Wait for events . `timeout` in seconds ( float ) With arguments `maxevents`.

Access a member of the archive as a binary file-like object . `name` can be either the name of a file within the archive or a ZipInfo object . `pwd` is the password used to decrypt encrypted ZIP files .
Return a datetime with the same attributes , except for those attributes given new values by whichever keyword arguments are specified . With arguments `second`.

Simple writer class which writes output on the `file` object passed in as file or , if file is omitted , on standard output . The output is simply word-wrapped to the number of columns specified by `maxcol` .
Retrieve the next item from the `iterator` by calling its __next__ ( ) method .

Constructor for the GzipFile class , which simulates most of the methods of a file object , with the exception of the truncate ( ) method . The `compresslevel` argument is an integer from 0 to 9 controlling the level of compression ; 1 is fastest and produces the least compression , and 9 is slowest and produces the most compression .
Return a new record object by calling MSICreateRecord ( ) . `count` is the number of fields of the record .
Return offset of local time from UTC , as a timedelta object that is positive east of UTC . With arguments `dt`.
Similar to CGIHandler , but instead of using the sys and os modules , the CGI environment and I/O streams are specified explicitly . With arguments `stdin`, `stdout`, `stderr`, `environ`.
Generate a UUID based on the MD5 hash of a `namespace` identifier ( which is a UUID ) and a `name` ( which is a string ) .
Open an LZMA-compressed file in binary `mode` . In this case , the `check` and `preset` arguments should not be used .
Called when a connection is made . The `transport` argument is the transport representing the connection .
Identical to the split ( ) function , using the compiled pattern . With arguments `string`, `maxsplit`.
Returns input_charset as a string coerced to lower case .
All built-in, non-system-exiting exceptions are derived from this class.
Return an iterator `object` .
Return a str version of `object` .

A buffered text stream over a BufferedIOBase binary stream . If `write_through` is True , calls to write ( ) are guaranteed not to be buffered : any data written on the TextIOWrapper object is immediately handled to its underlying binary `buffer` .
Serialize `obj` to a JSON formatted str using this conversion table . With arguments `**kw`, `cls`.
Delete old `mailbox` named mailbox .
Decode parameters list according to RFC 2231. `params` is a sequence of 2-tuples containing elements of the form ( content-type , string-value ) .

Find all the test modules by recursing into subdirectories from the specified start directory , and return a TestSuite object containing them . `start_dir` can be a dotted module name as well as a directory . Only test files that match `pattern` will be loaded .
Return information about the transport or underlying resources it uses . `name` is a string representing the piece of transport-specific information to get .
For a date d , str ( d ) is equivalent to d.isoformat ( ) .

Returns a new instance of the SMTPHandler class . To specify a non-standard SMTP port , use the ( host , port ) tuple format for the `mailhost` argument . The `toaddrs` should be a list of strings . The instance is initialized with the from and to addresses and `subject` line of the email . With arguments `fromaddr`.
Create a turtle . With arguments `canvas`.

Convert doctest tests from one or more text files to a unittest.TestSuite . Optional argument `optionflags` specifies the default doctest options for the tests , created by or-ing together individual option flags . With arguments `*paths`.
Load a plist from a bytes object . With arguments `data`, `fmt`.
Set or remove the `function` invoked by the rl_startup_hook callback of the underlying library .
Add element `elem` to the set .

Similar to the parse ( ) method , except it takes a string object instead of a file-like object . Calling this method on a string is equivalent to wrapping `text` in a StringIO instance first and calling parse ( ) .
Adds a new tab to the notebook . With arguments `child`, `**kw`.
Return the list of objects that directly refer to any of objs . With arguments `*objs`.

Get the size of the terminal window . If the terminal size can not be successfully queried , either because the system doesn ’ t support querying , or because we are not connected to a terminal , the value given in `fallback` parameter is used . With arguments `lines)`.
Add a mark with the given `id` ( larger than 0 ) , and the given `name` at the given position . With arguments `pos`.
Clean up indentation from docstrings that are indented to line up with blocks of code . With arguments `doc`.
This function takes an input `source` and an optional `base` URL and returns a fully resolved InputSource object ready for reading .
Set the scrolling region from line `top` to line `bottom` .
Set the list of supplemental group ids associated with the current process to `groups` .

Inform the formatter that data has been added to the current paragraph out-of-band . The optional `flag` argument can be set to false if the writer manipulations produced a hard line break at the end of the output .
Copy the contents of the file-like object `fsrc` to the file-like object `fdst` .
Return the absolute value of a number . With arguments `x`.

This exception is raised when a system function returns a system-related error , including I/O failures such as “ file not found ” or “ disk full ” ( not for illegal argument types or other incidental errors ) .
Return a string representation suitable to be sent as HTTP headers . `sep` is used to join the headers together , and is by default the combination '\r\n ' ( CRLF ) .
Wait for events . `timeout` in seconds ( float ) With arguments `maxevents`.

Return an absolute pathname of a file that did not exist at the time the call is made . The `prefix` , `suffix` , and `dir` arguments are similar to those of mkstemp ( ) , except that bytes file names , suffix=None and prefix=None are not supported .
Create a hard link pointing to `src` named `dst` .
Return True if d has a key key, else False.
Create an object to `trace` execution of a single statement or expression . `count` enables counting of line numbers .
Send a `file` until EOF is reached by using high-performance os.sendfile and return the total number of bytes which were sent . `offset` tells from where to start reading the file .
Set the value of `a` at index `b` to `c` .
Read exactly `n` bytes .
Draw a circle with given `radius` . As the circle is approximated by an inscribed regular polygon , `steps` determines the number of steps to use .
Return `digest` of `msg` for given secret `key` and digest .
An implementation of the built-in __import__ ( ) function . With arguments `name`.
Set the `usage` string according to the rules described above for the usage constructor keyword argument .
Compose a raw device number from the `major` and `minor` device numbers .
Set the virtual screen cursor to `y` , `x` .
Pop and return the smallest item from the `heap` , maintaining the heap invariant .

Return a m-column calendar for an entire year as a multi-line string . Optional parameters `w` , `l` , and `c` are for date column width , lines per week , and number of spaces between month columns , respectively . With arguments `theyear`, `m`.

Return the entire message flattened as a string . When optional `unixfrom` is true , the envelope header is included in the returned string . For backward compatibility reasons , `maxheaderlen` defaults to 0 , so if you want a different value you must override it explicitly ( the value specified for max_line_length in the `policy` will be ignored by this method ) .
Raised by built-in function next() and an iterator’s __next__() method to signal that there are no further items produced by the iterator.

Generate the file names in a directory tree by walking the tree either top-down or bottom-up . For each directory in the tree rooted at directory `top` ( including top itself ) , it yields a 3-tuple ( dirpath , dirnames , filenames ) .
Return a Boolean value , i.e . `x` is converted using the standard truth testing procedure .

Decode the Base64 encoded bytes-like object or ASCII string `s` and return the decoded bytes . If `validate` is False ( the default ) , characters that are neither in the normal base-64 alphabet nor the alternative alphabet are discarded prior to the padding check .

Acquire a lock , blocking or non-blocking . With the `block` argument set to True ( the default ) , the method call will block until the lock is in an unlocked state , then set it to locked and return True .

Encode the bytes-like object `s` using Base64 and return the encoded bytes . Optional `altchars` must be a bytes-like object of at least length 2 ( additional characters are ignored ) which specifies an alternative alphabet for the + and / characters .
Increment the line number of each `node` in the tree starting at node by n. This is useful to “ move code ” to a different location in a file . With arguments `n`.

Run the `cmd` shell command . The `limit` argument sets the buffer limit for StreamReader wrappers for Process.stdout and Process.stderr ( if subprocess.PIPE is passed to `stdout` and `stderr` arguments ) . With arguments `**kwds`.

The function provides scrypt password-based key derivation function as defined in RFC 7914 . `password` and `salt` must be bytes-like objects . `n` is the CPU/Memory cost factor , `r` the block size , `p` parallelization factor and `maxmem` limits memory ( OpenSSL 1.1.0 defaults to 32 MiB ) .
The true value of the bool type.
Codec details when looking up the codec registry . With arguments `encode`, `decode`.
Returns an explanatory string for a given error number `errno` .
Return a proxy object that delegates method calls to a parent or sibling class of `type` .
Transform a method into a static method.
The name of the class, function, method, descriptor, or generator instance.
Closely emulate the behavior of the interactive Python interpreter . With arguments `filename`.

Insert an entry into the list of warnings filter specifications . This checks the types of the arguments , compiles the `message` and `module` regular expressions , and inserts them as a tuple in the list of warnings filters . With arguments `action`.

Return a list of the best “ good enough ” matches . `word` is a sequence for which close matches are desired ( typically a string ) , and `possibilities` is a list of sequences against which to match word ( typically a list of strings ) . Optional argument `n` ( default 3 ) is the maximum number of close matches to return ; n must be greater than 0 .
Create a Timer instance with the given statement , `setup` code and `timer` function and run its timeit ( ) method with `number` executions . With arguments `stmt`.
Set the maximum depth of the Python interpreter stack to `limit` .
Construct a URL from a tuple as returned by urlparse ( ) . The `parts` argument can be any six-item iterable .

A subclass of collections.abc.MutableMapping which stores pickled values in the `dict` object . The `keyencoding` parameter is the encoding used to encode keys before they are used with the underlying dict .
Return the largest item in an iterable or the largest of two or more arguments . With arguments `arg1`, `arg2`, `*args`.
A specification for a module ’ s import-system-related state . A string for the fully-qualified `name` of the module . The `loader` to use for loading .

Load configuration from any object that provides a dict-like items ( ) method . If the used `dictionary` type preserves order , sections and their keys will be added in order . Optional argument `source` specifies a context-specific name of the dictionary passed .
Set the `spacing` style for the writer .

Flushes changes made to the in-memory copy of a file back to disk . If `offset` and `size` are specified , only changes to the given range of bytes will be flushed to disk ; otherwise , the whole extent of the mapping is flushed .
Try to match a single dict with the supplied arguments . With arguments `self`, `d`, `**kwargs`.

For existing code calling readfp ( ) with arguments which don ’ t support iteration , the following generator may be used as a wrapper around the file-like object : Instead of parser.readfp ( `fp` ) use parser.read_file ( readline_generator ( fp ) ) .
Seek to the specified frame number . With arguments `pos`.

Compile a regular expression `pattern` into a regular expression object , which can be used for matching using its match ( ) , search ( ) and other methods , described below . The expression ’ s behaviour can be modified by specifying a `flags` value .

This method is not defined in BaseHandler , but subclasses should define it if they want to post-process responses of the given protocol . `req` will be a Request object . `response` will be an object implementing the same interface as the return value of urlopen ( ) .
Return a Boolean value , i.e .
Exception raised on any errors.
Outputs a symbolic disassembly of the `pickle` to the file-like object `out` , defaulting to sys.stdout .
Set a new breakpoint . If the `lineno` line doesn ’ t exist for the `filename` passed as argument , return an error message . With arguments `cond`, `funcname`.
Create a mapping from positional and keyword arguments to parameters . Returns BoundArguments if `*args` and `**kwargs` match the signature , or raises a TypeError .
Connect to a `host` on a given `port` .
Get channel binding data for current connection , as a bytes object . The `cb_type` parameter allow selection of the desired channel binding type .

This method makes a backup of a SQLite database even while it ’ s being accessed by other clients , or concurrently by the same connection . The copy will be written into the mandatory argument `target` , that must be another Connection instance . By default , or when `pages` is either 0 or a negative integer , the entire database is copied in a single step ; otherwise the method performs a loop copying up to pages pages at a time .
Identify the client using a plaintext `password` . With arguments `user`.
Get a list of frame records for a `traceback` ’ s frame and all inner frames .
Get a list of frame records for a `traceback` ’ s frame and all inner frames .
Return a record describing the columns of the view , through calling MsiViewGetColumnInfo ( ) . `kind` can be either MSICOLINFO_NAMES or MSICOLINFO_TYPES .
Write the XML-RPC encoding of this DateTime item to the `out` stream object .
Returns a new instance of the NTEventLogHandler class . The `appname` is used to define the application name as it appears in the event log .

This class provides run_script ( ) and report ( ) methods to determine the set of modules imported by a script . `path` can be a list of directories to search for modules ; if not specified , sys.path is used . `debug` sets the debugging level ; higher values make the class print debugging messages about what it ’ s doing .

For common and simple use cases , no other functionality is required . To satisfy this need for additional information , you can replace the `default` field value with a call to the provided field ( ) function . As shown above , the MISSING value is a sentinel object used to detect if the default and `default_factory` parameters are provided .

Create a Timer instance with the given statement , `setup` code and `timer` function and run its timeit ( ) method with `number` executions . The optional `globals` argument specifies a namespace in which to execute the code . With arguments `stmt`.
Formats a number `val` according to the current LC_MONETARY settings . If `grouping` is true ( which is not the default ) , grouping is done with the value .
All arguments are optional . With arguments `minute`.

Schedule a new event . The `time` `argument` should be a numeric type compatible with the return value of the timefunc function passed to the constructor . Events scheduled for the same time will be executed in the order of their `priority` . Executing the event means executing `action` ( *argument , **kwargs ) .
Get information about a `frame` or traceback object . With arguments `context`.
( Windows version ) Maps `length` bytes from the file specified by the file handle `fileno` , and creates a mmap object . With arguments `access`.
( Only supported on BSD . ) With arguments `ident`, `data`.
Unpack from `buffer` starting at position `offset` , according to the `format` string format .
Raise an error if `key` is not a valid RFC 2109 attribute , otherwise behave the same as dict.setdefault ( ) . With arguments `value`.
Extract all `members` from the archive to the current working directory or directory `path` .
Return a proxy object that delegates method calls to a parent or sibling class of `type` . With arguments `object-or-type`.
Write a list of `lines` to the stream .
Call timeit ( ) a few times . The second argument specifies the `number` argument for timeit ( ) . With arguments `repeat`.
Get a list of frame records for a `traceback` ’ s frame and all inner frames . With arguments `context`.
Return a str version of `object` .
For a datetime instance d , str ( d ) is equivalent to d.isoformat ( ' ' ) .
Fused multiply-add . With arguments `other`, `third`.
This will send a request to the server using the HTTP request `method` method and the selector `url` . If `body` is specified , the specified data is sent after the `headers` are finished .
Create an object to `trace` execution of a single statement or expression .
All following arguments are optional and can be accessed as instance attributes as well . The `tarinfo` argument can be used to replace the default TarInfo class with a different one .
Send an XOVER command . `start` and `end` are article numbers delimiting the range of articles to select . With arguments `file`.

Replace % xx escapes by their single-character equivalent . `string` must be a str . The optional `encoding` and `errors` parameters specify how to decode percent-encoded sequences into Unicode characters , as accepted by the bytes.decode ( ) method .
The name of the class, function, method, descriptor, or generator instance.
Fetch ( parts of ) messages . `message_parts` should be a string of message part names enclosed within parentheses , eg : `` ( UID BODY [ TEXT ] ) '' . With arguments `message_set`.
Invoke the built-in help system .
Close currently selected mailbox .
Set the size and position of the main window . With arguments `width`.
Integer value to control debugging output.
Sets the data buffer unpack `position` to position .
Encode the bytes-like object `b` using Ascii85 and return the encoded bytes . `pad` controls whether the input is padded to a multiple of 4 before encoding .

Same as the standard C memset library function : fills the memory block at address `dst` with `count` bytes of value c. dst must be an integer specifying an address , or a ctypes instance . With arguments `c`.
Recursively descend the directory tree named by `dir` , compiling all .py files along the way . If `force` is true , modules are re-compiled even if the timestamps are up to date .
Raised when the interpreter finds an internal error, but the situation does not look so serious to cause it to abandon all hope.
A basic test runner implementation that outputs results to a `stream` . With arguments `failfast`.

Open a gzip-compressed file in binary or text `mode` , returning a file object . The `filename` argument can be an actual filename ( a str or bytes object ) , or an existing file object to read from or write to . The `compresslevel` argument is an integer from 0 to 9 , as for the GzipFile constructor .
Return an iterator `object` . If the second argument , `sentinel` , is given , then object must be a callable object .
Close connection established in open .
Set an ACL for `mailbox` . With arguments `who`, `what`.
Send the `signal` number to the subprocess , as in subprocess.Popen.send_signal ( ) .
Perform the operation `cmd` on file descriptor `fd` ( file objects providing a fileno ( ) method are accepted as well ) .
Appends items from the string , interpreting the string as an array of machine values ( as if it had been read from a file using the fromfile ( ) method ) . With arguments `s`.

Return an integer object constructed from a number or string `x` , or return 0 if no arguments are given . If x is not a number or if `base` is given , then x must be a string , bytes , or bytearray instance representing an integer literal in radix base .
All arguments are optional . `tzinfo` may be None , or an instance of a tzinfo subclass .

Open the URL `url` , which can be either a string or a Request object . `data` must be an object specifying additional data to be sent to the server , or None if no such data is needed . If `context` is specified , it must be a ssl.SSLContext instance describing the various SSL options .

Returns a new instance of the HTTPHandler class . The `host` can be of the form host : port , should you need to use a specific port number . If no `method` is specified , GET is used . With arguments `url`.
Returns the volume of a given mixer `control` .

Convert a mapping object or a sequence of two-element tuples , which may contain str or bytes objects , to a percent-encoded ASCII text string . When a sequence of two-element tuples is used as the `query` argument , the first element of each tuple is a key and the second is a value . The value element in itself can be a sequence and in that case , if the optional parameter `doseq` is evaluates to True , individual key=value pairs separated by ' & ' are generated for each element of the value sequence for the key . For maximum control of what is quoted , use quote and specify a value for `safe` .
Auxiliary method for getting a `filename` in a canonical form , that is , as a case-normalized ( on case-insensitive filesystems ) absolute path , stripped of surrounding angle brackets .

An HTTPConnection instance represents one transaction with an HTTP server . It should be instantiated passing it a `host` and optional `port` number . If the optional `timeout` parameter is given , blocking operations ( like connection attempts ) will timeout after that many seconds ( if it is not given , the global default timeout setting is used ) .

A processing class used to extract the DocTests that are relevant to a given object , from its docstring and the docstrings of its contained objects . The optional argument `parser` specifies the DocTestParser object ( or a drop-in replacement ) that is used to extract doctests from docstrings .

For existing code calling readfp ( ) with arguments which don ’ t support iteration , the following generator may be used as a wrapper around the file-like object : Instead of parser.readfp ( `fp` ) use parser.read_file ( readline_generator ( fp ) ) . With arguments `filename`.

Find all the test modules by recursing into subdirectories from the specified start directory , and return a TestSuite object containing them . `start_dir` can be a dotted module name as well as a directory . Only test files that match `pattern` will be loaded .
Rather than being a function , list is actually a mutable sequence type , as documented in Lists and Sequence Types — list , tuple , range .

Return a 2-tuple ; the first element is a string containing the command line to be executed ( which can be passed to os.system ( ) ) , and the second element is the mailcap entry for a given MIME type . With arguments `caps`.
Open an AIFF or AIFF-C `file` and return an object instance with methods that are described below .

Sets given `interval` timer ( one of signal.ITIMER_REAL , signal.ITIMER_VIRTUAL or signal.ITIMER_PROF ) specified by `which` to fire after `seconds` ( float is accepted , different from alarm ( ) ) and after that every interval seconds ( if interval is non-zero ) .
Moves `item` to position `index` in `parent` ’ s list of children .
Decorator for __repr__ ( ) methods to detect recursive calls within the same thread . If a recursive call is made , the `fillvalue` is returned , otherwise , the usual __repr__ ( ) call is made .
Strip the `stderr` of a Python process from potential debug output emitted by the interpreter .
Abstract base class for arrays . With arguments `*args`.

Class used to represent information about a member of an archive . `filename` should be the full name of the archive member , and `date_time` should be a tuple containing six fields which describe the time of the last modification to the file ; the fields are described in section ZipInfo Objects . With arguments `1`, `1`, `0`, `0`, `0)`.
Specialized version of sendmsg ( ) for AF_ALG socket . With arguments `msg`, `op`, `iv`.
Return the current contents of history item at `index` .
Return the value of the named attribute of `object` . `name` must be a string .

snippet: msilib.Feature(db, id, title, desc, display, level=1, attributes=0)
intent: Add a new record to the Feature table , using the values `id` , parent.id , `title` , `desc` , `display` , `level` , `directory` , and `attributes` . With arguments `db`.
Return a `k` length list of unique elements chosen from the `population` sequence or set .

Test examples associated with object `f` ; for example , f may be a string , a module , a function , or a class object . A shallow copy of dictionary argument `globs` is used for the execution context . Optional argument `optionflags` works as for function testfile ( ) above .
Connect to a `host` on a given `port` .
Rather than being a function , list is actually a mutable sequence type , as documented in Lists and Sequence Types — list , tuple , range .
Encode the contents of the binary `input` file and write the resulting base64 encoded data to the `output` file .
Return the complex number x with polar coordinates `r` and `phi` .
Make the path absolute , resolving any symlinks . If the path doesn ’ t exist and `strict` is True , FileNotFoundError is raised .
Move an existing `key` to either end of an ordered dictionary .
Write all items ( as machine values ) to the file object `f` .

Load a module that was previously found by find_module ( ) ( or by an otherwise conducted search yielding compatible results ) . The `name` argument indicates the full module name ( including the package name , if this is a submodule of a package ) . The `file` argument is an open file , and `pathname` is the corresponding file name ; these can be None and `` , respectively , when the module is a package or not being loaded from a file . The `description` argument is a tuple , as would be returned by get_suffixes ( ) , describing what kind of module must be loaded .
Enters a new context manager and adds its __exit__ ( ) method to the callback stack . With arguments `cm`.

The inverse of parseaddr ( ) , this takes a 2-tuple of the form ( realname , email_address ) and returns the string value suitable for a To or Cc header . If the first element of `pair` is false , then the second element is returned unmodified . Optional `charset` is the character set that will be used in the RFC 2047 encoding of the realname if the realname contains non-ASCII characters .
Return the position of `x` in the deque ( at or after index `start` and before index `stop` ) .

Return a string representing the date and time in ISO 8601 format , YYYY-MM-DDTHH : MM : SS.ffffff or , if microsecond is 0 , YYYY-MM-DDTHH : MM : SS The optional argument `timespec` specifies the number of additional components of the time to include ( the default is 'auto ' ) .
Shutdown connection to server .
A generic version of collections.deque . With arguments `deque`.

A processing class used to extract the DocTests that are relevant to a given object , from its docstring and the docstrings of its contained objects . The optional argument `verbose` can be used to display the objects searched by the finder .
Get the default value for a namespace attribute , as set by either add_argument ( ) or by set_defaults ( ) : With arguments `dest`.
Remove d[key] from d.  Raises a KeyError if key is not in the map.
Create a Timer instance with the given statement , `setup` code and `timer` function and run its timeit ( ) method with `number` executions . With arguments `stmt`.
A subclass of Mailbox for mailboxes in mbox format . If `create` is True , the mailbox is created if it does not exist . With arguments `path`.

Return a list of the DocTests that are defined by `obj` ’ s docstring , or by any of its contained objects ’ docstrings . The optional argument `name` specifies the object ’ s name ; this name will be used to construct names for the returned DocTests . The optional parameter `module` is the module that contains the given object .
Sums `start` and the items of an `iterable` from left to right and returns the total .

These functions all execute a new program , replacing the current process ; they do not return . The other variants , execl ( ) , execle ( ) , execv ( ) , and execve ( ) , will not use the PATH variable to locate the executable ; `path` must contain an appropriate absolute or relative path . The “ v ” variants are good when the number of parameters is variable , with the arguments being passed in a list or tuple as the `args` parameter .
Return or set the `pen` ’ s attributes in a “ pen-dictionary ” with the following key/value pairs : With arguments `**pendict`.
Perform the operation `cmd` on file descriptor `fd` ( file objects providing a fileno ( ) method are accepted as well ) . The argument `arg` can either be an integer value , or a bytes object .
Store the value from `stdout` .

snippet: window.border(ls, rs, ts, bs, tl, tr)
intent: Draw a border around the edges of the window . With arguments `ls`, `rs`, `ts`, `bs`, `tl`, `tr`.
The version number of this module, as a string.
Return a floating point number constructed from a number or string `x` .

snippet: msilib.init_database(name, schema, ProductName, ProductCode, ProductVersion, Manufacturer)
intent: Create and return a new database `name` , initialize it with `schema` , and set the properties `ProductName` , `ProductCode` , `ProductVersion` , and `Manufacturer` .

Open an LZMA-compressed file in binary or text `mode` , returning a file object . The `filename` argument can be either an actual file name ( given as a str , bytes or path-like object ) , in which case the named file is opened , or it can be an existing file object to read from or write to . When opening a file for reading , the `format` and `filters` arguments have the same meanings as for LZMADecompressor .
A class to handle HTTP Cookies . With arguments `cookiejar`.
( Only supported on BSD . ) With arguments `ident`, `data`.
Exit the process with status `n` , without calling cleanup handlers , flushing stdio buffers , etc .

Return an estimated length for the object o . First try to return its actual length , then an estimate using object.__length_hint__ ( ) , and finally return the `default` value . With arguments `obj`.
Return the formatted representation of `object` as a string . `indent` , `width` , `depth` and `compact` will be passed to the PrettyPrinter constructor as formatting parameters .
Rather than being a function , tuple is actually an immutable sequence type , as documented in Tuples and Sequence Types — list , tuple , range .
Return a dictionary representing the current global symbol table .
Add a `director` as parent .

Resolve MRO entries dynamically as specified by PEP 560 . This function looks for items in `bases` that are not instances of type , and returns a tuple where each such object that has an __mro_entries__ method is replaced with an unpacked result of calling this method .
Encode the bytes-like object `b` using Ascii85 and return the encoded bytes . `pad` controls whether the input is padded to a multiple of 4 before encoding .
Sends `data` to the remote server .
Compute a 16-bit CRC `value` of `data` , starting with value as the initial CRC , and return the result .

Pop up a dialog window for input of a number . `title` is the title of the dialog window , `prompt` is a text mostly describing what numerical information to input . `default` : default value , `minval` : minimum value for input , `maxval` : maximum value for input The number input must be in the range minval .. maxval if these are given .
Converts the dataclass `instance` to a dict ( by using the factory function `dict_factory` ) .
Similar to map ( `func` , `*iterables` ) except : The ( approximate ) size of these chunks can be specified by setting `chunksize` to a positive integer .
Convert the color from HLS coordinates to RGB coordinates . With arguments `h`, `l`, `s`.
Return a “ memory view ” object created from the given argument . With arguments `obj`.
Return a reader object which will iterate over lines in the given `csvfile` . With arguments `**fmtparams`.
Reads `size` bytes from the remote server .
This function handles the exception described by `info` ( a 3-tuple containing the result of sys.exc_info ( ) ) , formatting its traceback as text and returning the result as a string .
Shutdown connection to server .
Returns a new instance of the Formatter class . If no `fmt` is specified , ' % ( message ) s ' is used .
Register `func` as a function to be executed at termination . With arguments `*args`, `**kwargs`.

The arguments are a string and optional `globals` and `locals` . The `expression` argument is parsed and evaluated as a Python expression ( technically speaking , a condition list ) using the globals and locals dictionaries as global and local namespace .

Return the MIME part that is the best candidate to be the “ body ” of the message . `preferencelist` must be a sequence of strings from the set related , html , and plain , and indicates the order of preference for the content type of the part returned . With arguments `'html'`, `'plain')`.
Convert a time expressed in seconds since the epoch to a string representing local time . If `secs` is not provided or None , the current time as returned by time ( ) is used .
Similar to map ( `func` , `*iterables` ) except : The ( approximate ) size of these chunks can be specified by setting `chunksize` to a positive integer .
Open `file` and return a corresponding file object . `mode` is an optional string that specifies the mode in which the file is opened .
Return the docstring of the given `node` ( which must be a FunctionDef , AsyncFunctionDef , ClassDef , or Module node ) , or None if it has no docstring .
Return a controller object for the browser type `using` .
Return True if any element of the `iterable` is true .
Return a view object , by calling MSIDatabaseOpenView ( ) . `sql` is the SQL statement to execute .
All arguments are optional . With arguments `second`.

By default , ArgumentParser groups command-line arguments into “ positional arguments ” and “ optional arguments ” when displaying help messages . The add_argument_group ( ) method accepts `title` and `description` arguments which can be used to customize this display :
Subelement factory . `parent` is the parent element . `tag` is the subelement name . With arguments `**extra`.
Query or modify the options for the specified `column` . With arguments `**kw`.
Comment element factory . `text` is a string containing the comment string .
Return a view object , by calling MSIDatabaseOpenView ( ) . `sql` is the SQL statement to execute .

Similar to the parse ( ) method , except it takes a string object instead of a file-like object . Calling this method on a string is equivalent to wrapping `text` in a StringIO instance first and calling parse ( ) .
Raised when the interpreter finds an internal error, but the situation does not look so serious to cause it to abandon all hope.

Return an estimated length for the object o . First try to return its actual length , then an estimate using object.__length_hint__ ( ) , and finally return the `default` value . With arguments `obj`.
Create a Timer instance with the given statement , `setup` code and `timer` function and run its `repeat` ( ) method with the given repeat count and `number` executions . With arguments `stmt`.
This method sorts the list in place , using only < comparisons between items . `reverse` is a boolean value .
Create an application archive from `source` . The `main` argument specifies the name of a callable which will be used as the main program for the archive .
Returns an explanatory string for a given error number `errno` .
Return an iterator over the keys of the dictionary . With arguments `d`.
Return `x` to the power `y` ; if `z` is present , return x to the power y , modulo z ( computed more efficiently than pow ( x , y ) % z ) .

Scan through `string` looking for the first location where this regular expression produces a match , and return a corresponding match object . The optional second parameter `pos` gives an index in the string where the search is to start ; it defaults to 0 . The optional parameter `endpos` limits how far the string will be searched ; it will be as if the string is endpos characters long , so only the characters from pos to endpos - 1 will be searched for a match .
Decorator for __repr__ ( ) methods to detect recursive calls within the same thread . If a recursive call is made , the `fillvalue` is returned , otherwise , the usual __repr__ ( ) call is made .

Decodes data from the stream and returns the resulting object . The `size` argument indicates the approximate maximum number of encoded bytes or code points to read for decoding . The `chars` argument indicates the number of decoded code points or bytes to return .

Test examples associated with object `f` ; for example , f may be a string , a module , a function , or a class object . A shallow copy of dictionary argument `globs` is used for the execution context . Optional argument `optionflags` works as for function testfile ( ) above .
Parse a `string` representing a time according to a `format` .
Perform the lock `operation` operation on file descriptor `fd` ( file objects providing a fileno ( ) method are accepted as well ) .
Bootstraps pip into the current or designated environment . `root` specifies an alternative root directory to install relative to .
Enable “ passive ” mode if `val` is true , otherwise disable passive mode .
Return a `k` sized list of elements chosen from the `population` with replacement . If a `weights` sequence is specified , selections are made according to the relative weights .

Authenticate command — requires response processing . `mechanism` specifies which authentication mechanism is to be used - it should appear in the instance variable capabilities in the form AUTH=mechanism . `authobject` must be a callable object :
Integer value to control debugging output.

This function causes the cgitb module to take over the interpreter ’ s default handling for exceptions by setting the value of sys.excepthook . The optional argument `display` defaults to 1 and can be set to 0 to suppress sending the traceback to the browser . If the optional argument `format` is `` html '' , the output is formatted as HTML .
Constructor for a StreamWriter instance . All `stream` writers must provide this constructor interface .
Make an iterator that filters elements from `data` returning only those that have a corresponding element in `selectors` that evaluates to True .

Disassemble the `x` object . The disassembly is written as text to the supplied `file` argument if provided and to sys.stdout otherwise . The maximal `depth` of recursion is limited by depth unless it is None .

Recursive directory or file renaming function . After the rename , directories corresponding to rightmost path segments of the `old` name will be pruned away using removedirs ( ) . Works like rename ( ) , except creation of any intermediate directories needed to make the `new` pathname good is attempted first .
Establish a network connection and return a pair of ( reader , writer ) objects . With arguments `family`.
Set the value of `a` at index `b` to `c` .
Return the nameprepped version of `label` .

snippet: hashlib.scrypt(password, salt, n, r, p, dklen=64)
intent: The function provides scrypt password-based key derivation function as defined in RFC 7914 . `password` and `salt` must be bytes-like objects . `n` is the CPU/Memory cost factor , `r` the block size , `p` parallelization factor and `maxmem` limits memory ( OpenSSL 1.1.0 defaults to 32 MiB ) . `dklen` is the length of the derived key .
Return a copy of the string in which each character has been mapped through the given translation `table` .
Return an integer object constructed from a number or string `x` , or return 0 if no arguments are given .
The class used to represent an email address . As a convenience `addr_spec` can be specified instead of `username` and `domain` , in which case username and domain will be parsed from the addr_spec .
Write a list of `lines` to the stream .
Set the maximum depth of the Python interpreter stack to `limit` .

The main configuration parser . When `strict` is True ( the default ) , the parser won ’ t allow for any section or option duplicates while reading from a single source ( file , string or dictionary ) , raising DuplicateSectionError or DuplicateOptionError . With arguments `':')`, `';')`.
Return a guess for whether wsgi.url_scheme should be “ http ” or “ https ” , by checking for a HTTPS environment variable in the `environ` dictionary .

A command-line program that loads a set of tests from `module` and runs them ; this is primarily for making test modules conveniently executable . The `testLoader` argument has to be a TestLoader instance , and defaults to defaultTestLoader .

Return a new sorted list from the items in `iterable` . `key` specifies a function of one argument that is used to extract a comparison key from each element in iterable ( for example , key=str.lower ) . `reverse` is a boolean value .
Return the `string` obtained by replacing the leftmost non-overlapping occurrences of `pattern` in string by the replacement `repl` .
Delete old `mailbox` named mailbox .
Rather than being a function , range is actually an immutable sequence type , as documented in Ranges and Sequence Types — list , tuple , range . With arguments `start`, `stop`.

Schedule a new event . The `time` `argument` should be a numeric type compatible with the return value of the timefunc function passed to the constructor . Events scheduled for the same time will be executed in the order of their `priority` . Executing the event means executing `action` ( *argument , **kwargs ) .
Return the value of the var ContextVar variable.
This will send a request to the server using the HTTP request `method` method and the selector `url` . The `encode_chunked` argument is only relevant if Transfer-Encoding is specified in headers .
Sets the callable `application` as the WSGI application that will receive requests .
Temporarily sets the current theme to `themename` , apply specified `settings` and then restore the previous theme .
Run the examples in `test` ( a DocTest object ) , and display the results using the writer function `out` .
Moves `item` to position `index` in `parent` ’ s list of children .
Set the main `type` and subtype for the Content-Type `header` . If `requote` is False , this leaves the existing header ’ s quoting as is , otherwise the parameters will be quoted ( the default ) .

patch ( ) acts as a function decorator , class decorator or a context manager . Inside the body of the function or with statement , the `target` is patched with a `new` object . `new_callable` allows you to specify a different class , or callable object , that will be called to `create` the new object . With arguments `**kwargs`.
Windows only : this function is probably the worst-named thing in ctypes . If `descr` is not specified , FormatError ( ) is called to get a textual description of the error .
Create an object to `trace` execution of a single statement or expression . `count` enables counting of line numbers .
Decompress `data` , a bytes-like object .
Used by class Screen , which thus automatically provides a ScrolledCanvas as playground for the turtles . With arguments `master`.
Write the XML-RPC encoding of this DateTime item to the `out` stream object .
Copy the contents of the file-like object `fsrc` to the file-like object `fdst` .
Return a proxy object that delegates method calls to a parent or sibling class of `type` .
A SQLite database connection has the following attributes and methods:
Display `url` using the default browser . If `new` is 0 , the url is opened in the same browser window if possible .

Open a ZIP `file` , where file can be a path to a file ( a string ) , a file-like object or a path-like object . `compression` is the ZIP compression method to use when writing the archive , and should be ZIP_STORED , ZIP_DEFLATED , ZIP_BZIP2 or ZIP_LZMA ; unrecognized values will cause NotImplementedError to be raised .
Get channel binding data for current connection , as a bytes object . The `cb_type` parameter allow selection of the desired channel binding type .
Shut down one or both halves of the connection . If `how` is SHUT_RD , further receives are disallowed .
Get up to `size` random bytes . The `flags` argument is a bit mask that can contain zero or more of the following values ORed together : os.GRND_RANDOM and GRND_NONBLOCK .

Compare `a` and `b` ( lists of bytes objects ) using `dfunc` ; yield a sequence of delta lines ( also bytes ) in the format returned by dfunc . Works by losslessly converting all inputs ( except n ) to str , and calling dfunc ( a , b , `fromfile` , `tofile` , `fromfiledate` , `tofiledate` , n , `lineterm` ) .

Replace % xx escapes by their single-character equivalent . `string` must be a str . The optional `encoding` and `errors` parameters specify how to decode percent-encoded sequences into Unicode characters , as accepted by the bytes.decode ( ) method .
Returns a process shared queue implemented using a pipe and a few locks/semaphores . With arguments `maxsize`.
A Semaphore object . The optional `value` argument gives the initial value for the internal counter ( 1 by default ) .

Execute the program path in a new process . If `mode` is P_NOWAIT , this function returns the process id of the new process ; if mode is P_WAIT , returns the process ’ s exit code if it exits normally , or -signal , where signal is the signal that killed the process . The variants which include a second “ p ” near the end ( spawnlp ( ) , spawnlpe ( ) , spawnvp ( ) , and spawnvpe ( ) ) will use the PATH environment variable to locate the program `file` .

Outputs a symbolic disassembly of the `pickle` to the file-like object `out` , defaulting to sys.stdout . If a nonzero value is given to `annotate` , each opcode in the output is annotated with a short description .
Set the access and modified `times` of the file specified by `path` . utime ( ) takes two optional parameters , times and `ns` .
Associate `dialect` with `name` .
Run the examples in `test` ( a DocTest object ) , and display the results using the writer function `out` .

snippet: msilib.init_database(name, schema, ProductName, ProductCode, ProductVersion, Manufacturer)
intent: Create and return a new database `name` , initialize it with `schema` , and set the properties `ProductName` , `ProductCode` , `ProductVersion` , and `Manufacturer` .

Encode a message header into an RFC-compliant format , possibly wrapping long lines and encapsulating non-ASCII parts in base64 or quoted-printable encodings . `linesep` specifies the characters used to separate the lines of the folded header . With arguments `\t'`.
Sums `start` and the items of an `iterable` from left to right and returns the total .
Open `file` and return a corresponding file object . `buffering` is an optional integer used to set the buffering policy .
Convert argument strings to objects and assign them as attributes of the `namespace` .
Return a copy of the string with all occurrences of substring `old` replaced by `new` . If the optional argument `count` is given , only the first count occurrences are replaced .
Return a slice object representing the set of indices specified by range ( start , `stop` , step ) .
Open `file` and return a corresponding file object .
Query or modify the options for the specified `column` . With arguments `**kw`.

Return an absolute pathname of a file that did not exist at the time the call is made . The `prefix` , `suffix` , and `dir` arguments are similar to those of mkstemp ( ) , except that bytes file names , suffix=None and prefix=None are not supported .

Return a copy of the string where all tab characters are replaced by one or more spaces , depending on the current column and the given tab size . Tab positions occur every `tabsize` characters ( default is 8 , giving tab positions at columns 0 , 8 , 16 and so on ) .
Return a floating point number constructed from a number or string `x` .
For backwards compatibility . With arguments `cmd`, `globals`, `locals`.

This function operates exactly as TemporaryFile ( ) does , except that data is spooled in memory until the file size exceeds `max_size` , or until the file ’ s fileno ( ) method is called , at which point the contents are written to disk and operation proceeds as with TemporaryFile ( ) . The returned object is a file-like object whose _file attribute is either an io.BytesIO or io.StringIO object ( depending on whether binary or text `mode` was specified ) or a true file object , depending on whether rollover ( ) has been called .

`name` is the name of the header to be mapped . `cls` is the specialized class to be used , along with base_class , to create the class used to instantiate headers that match name . With arguments `self`.
Add an entry to the Component table , and make this `component` the current component for this directory . If no `feature` is given , the current feature is used .
Return the message ’ s Content-Type parameters , as a list . Optional `failobj` is the object to return if there is no Content-Type `header` .
Implement this method in a subclass such that it returns a serializable object for `o` , or calls the base implementation ( to raise a TypeError ) .

Return the payload of the part as either a string ( for text parts ) , an EmailMessage object ( for message/rfc822 parts ) , or a bytes object ( for all other non-multipart types ) . If the part is a text part and `errors` is specified , use it as the error handler when decoding the payload to unicode . With arguments `msg`.
Add a mark with the given `id` ( larger than 0 ) , and the given `name` at the given position . With arguments `pos`.
This method is called to handle an HTML doctype declaration ( e.g . The `decl` parameter will be the entire contents of the declaration inside the < ! ... > markup ( e.g .

This static method returns a translation table usable for bytes.translate ( ) that will map each character in `from` into the character at the same position in `to` ; from and to must both be bytes-like objects and have the same length .
Return the position of `x` in the deque ( at or after index `start` and before index `stop` ) .

patch ( ) acts as a function decorator , class decorator or a context manager . Inside the body of the function or with statement , the `target` is patched with a `new` object . `new_callable` allows you to specify a different class , or callable object , that will be called to `create` the new object . With arguments `**kwargs`.
Return a dictionary representing the current global symbol table .
Allow an application to set the `locale` for errors and warnings .
Run the examples in `test` ( a DocTest object ) , and display the results using the writer function `out` .
Decompress `data` ( a bytes-like object ) , returning uncompressed data as bytes . If `max_length` is nonnegative , returns at most max_length bytes of decompressed data .
Add the `file` with the pathname `full` to the CAB file , under the name `logical` .
For common and simple use cases , no other functionality is required . With arguments `metadata`.
Prints the calendar for an entire `year` as returned by calendar ( ) . With arguments `w`, `c`.
Return `digest` of `msg` for given secret `key` and digest .
Run until the `future` ( an instance of Future ) has completed .
The true value of the bool type.

Return a possibly-empty list of path names that match `pathname` , which must be a string containing a path specification . If `recursive` is true , the pattern “ ** ” will match any files and zero or more directories , subdirectories and symbolic links to directories .
Create an object used to boxcar method calls . `server` is the eventual target of the call .
Translate a host name to IPv4 address format . With arguments `hostname`.

Returns a compression object , to be used for compressing data streams that won ’ t fit into memory at once . `level` is the compression level – an integer from 0 to 9 or -1 . `method` is the compression algorithm .

Returns a compression object , to be used for compressing data streams that won ’ t fit into memory at once . `level` is the compression level – an integer from 0 to 9 or -1 . `strategy` is used to tune the compression algorithm .
Install a timer that calls `fun` after `t` milliseconds .
Send user command , response should indicate that a password is required . With arguments `username`.
All arguments are optional and default to 0 . With arguments `minutes`.
Escape ' & ' , ' < ' , and ' > ' in a string of `data` . You can escape other strings of data by passing a dictionary as the optional `entities` parameter .

Open a gzip-compressed file in binary or text `mode` , returning a file object . The `filename` argument can be an actual filename ( a str or bytes object ) , or an existing file object to read from or write to . The `compresslevel` argument is an integer from 0 to 9 , as for the GzipFile constructor .

Copy a network object denoted by a URL to a local file . If the `url` uses the http : scheme identifier , the optional `data` argument may be given to specify a POST request ( normally the request type is GET ) . If the URL points to a local file , the object will not be copied unless `filename` is supplied .
Try to switch to UTF-8 mode .

Creates a new dataclass with name `cls_name` , `fields` as defined in fields , base classes as given in `bases` , and initialized with a `namespace` as given in namespace . The values of `init` , `repr` , `eq` , `order` , `unsafe_hash` , and `frozen` have the same meaning as they do in dataclass ( ) .

Open an LZMA-compressed file in binary or text `mode` , returning a file object . The `filename` argument can be either an actual file name ( given as a str , bytes or path-like object ) , in which case the named file is opened , or it can be an existing file object to read from or write to . When opening a file for reading , the `format` and `filters` arguments have the same meanings as for LZMADecompressor .
A subclass of Mailbox for mailboxes in mbox format . If `create` is True , the mailbox is created if it does not exist . With arguments `path`.
Rather than being a function , range is actually an immutable sequence type , as documented in Ranges and Sequence Types — list , tuple , range . With arguments `start`, `stop`.
The false value of the bool type.
Verify that `cert` ( in decoded format as returned by SSLSocket.getpeercert ( ) ) matches the given `hostname` .
Return the position of `x` in the deque ( at or after index `start` and before index `stop` ) .
Write all items ( as machine values ) to the file object `f` .
Returns an approximation of the Header as a string , using an unlimited line length .

The inverse of parseaddr ( ) , this takes a 2-tuple of the form ( realname , email_address ) and returns the string value suitable for a To or Cc header . If the first element of `pair` is false , then the second element is returned unmodified . Optional `charset` is the character set that will be used in the RFC 2047 encoding of the realname if the realname contains non-ASCII characters .

This class implements `temporary` breakpoints , ignore counts , disabling and ( re- ) enabling , and conditionals . Breakpoints are indexed by number through a list called bpbynumber and by ( `file` , `line` ) pairs through bplist . With arguments `self`.
Auxiliary method for getting a `filename` in a canonical form , that is , as a case-normalized ( on case-insensitive filesystems ) absolute path , stripped of surrounding angle brackets .
Return a dictionary representing the current global symbol table .
Return a new frozenset object , optionally with elements taken from `iterable` .
Returns an opened , file-like object for binary reading of the `resource` .
Subelement factory . `parent` is the parent element . `tag` is the subelement name . With arguments `**extra`.
Create a turtle . With arguments `canvas`.
Handles a doctype declaration . `name` is the doctype name . `pubid` is the public identifier . `system` is the system identifier .
Same as datetime.strftime ( ) . This makes it possible to specify a `format` string for a datetime object in formatted string literals and when using str.format ( ) .
Create a Timer instance with the given statement , `setup` code and `timer` function and run its timeit ( ) method with `number` executions . With arguments `stmt`.
If the debugger should stop on the current line , invoke the user_line ( ) method ( which should be overridden in subclasses ) . With arguments `frame`.

A buffered I/O object combining two unidirectional RawIOBase objects – one readable , the other writeable – into a single bidirectional endpoint . `reader` and `writer` are RawIOBase objects that are readable and writeable respectively .
Test x for non-membership in s.
Return `digest` of `msg` for given secret `key` and digest .

Returns the list of directories that will be searched for a named executable , similar to a shell , when launching a process . `env` , when specified , should be an environment variable dictionary to lookup the PATH in .
Add correct Cookie header to `request` .

Process objects represent activity that is run in a separate process . `group` should always be None ; it exists solely for compatibility with threading.Thread . `name` is the process name ( see name for more details ) .

This function implements the standard .mo file search algorithm . It takes a `domain` , identical to what textdomain ( ) takes . If `all` is given , it returns a list of all file names , in the order in which they appear in the languages list or the environment variables .
This function is used to turn the `capture` of warnings by logging on and off .

Return a new “ bytes ” object , which is an immutable sequence of integers in the range 0 < = x < 256. bytes is an immutable version of bytearray – it has the same non-mutating methods and the same indexing and slicing behavior .
Return a context manager that closes `thing` upon completion of the block .
Element class . `tag` is the element name . `attrib` is an optional dictionary , containing element attributes . With arguments `**extra`.
Convert a `value` to a “ formatted ” representation , as controlled by `format_spec` .
inline and attachment are the only valid values in common use.

snippet: ArgumentParser.add_argument(name or flags..., action, nargs, const, default, type, choices)
intent: Define how a single command-line argument should be parsed . With arguments `name or flags...`, `action`, `nargs`, `const`, `default`, `type`, `choices`.

Signals the start of an element in non-namespace mode . The `name` parameter contains the raw XML 1.0 name of the element type as a string and the `attrs` parameter holds an object of the Attributes interface ( see The Attributes Interface ) containing the attributes of the element .

This function causes the cgitb module to take over the interpreter ’ s default handling for exceptions by setting the value of sys.excepthook . The optional argument `display` defaults to 1 and can be set to 0 to suppress sending the traceback to the browser . The optional argument `context` is the number of lines of context to display around the current line of source code in the traceback ; this defaults to 5 .
Construct a PrettyPrinter instance . The desired output `width` is constrained using the width parameter ; the default is 80 characters .
Print exception information and stack trace entries from traceback object `tb` to `file` . The optional `limit` argument has the same meaning as for print_tb ( ) . With arguments `etype`, `value`.
Write all elements in `rows` ( an iterable of row objects as described above ) to the writer ’ s file object , formatted according to the current dialect .
Set the current process ’ s effective user id . With arguments `euid`.
Seek to the specified frame number . With arguments `pos`.
Compare the files named `f1` and `f2` , returning True if they seem equal , False otherwise . If `shallow` is true , files with identical os.stat ( ) signatures are taken to be equal .
Rather than being a function , list is actually a mutable sequence type , as documented in Lists and Sequence Types — list , tuple , range .
Prints the calendar for an entire `year` as returned by calendar ( ) . With arguments `w`.

An HTTPConnection instance represents one transaction with an HTTP server . It should be instantiated passing it a `host` and optional `port` number . If the optional `timeout` parameter is given , blocking operations ( like connection attempts ) will timeout after that many seconds ( if it is not given , the global default timeout setting is used ) .

Convert a mapping object or a sequence of two-element tuples , which may contain str or bytes objects , to a percent-encoded ASCII text string . When a sequence of two-element tuples is used as the `query` argument , the first element of each tuple is a key and the second is a value .
Instances of this class represent loaded shared libraries . With arguments `name`, `mode`, `handle`.

This function is useful for programs that want to emulate Python ’ s interpreter main loop ( a.k.a . `source` is the source string ; `filename` is the optional filename from which source was read , defaulting to ' < input > ' ; and `symbol` is the optional grammar start symbol , which should be either 'single ' ( the default ) or 'eval ' .
Identical to the pack ( ) function , using the compiled format . With arguments `v1`, `v2`.
Make an entry into the ControlEvent table for this control . With arguments `event`, `argument`, `ordering`.

For existing code calling readfp ( ) with arguments which don ’ t support iteration , the following generator may be used as a wrapper around the file-like object : Instead of parser.readfp ( `fp` ) use parser.read_file ( readline_generator ( fp ) ) .

Open a bzip2-compressed file in binary or text `mode` , returning a file object . As with the constructor for BZ2File , the `filename` argument can be an actual filename ( a str or bytes object ) , or an existing file object to read from or write to . In this case , the `encoding` , `errors` and `newline` arguments must not be provided .
Try to match a single dict with the supplied arguments . With arguments `self`, `d`, `**kwargs`.
Return the string obtained by doing backslash substitution on the `template` string template , as done by the sub ( ) method .
Return a copy of the string with leading characters removed . The `chars` argument is a string specifying the set of characters to be removed .
Rather than being a function , tuple is actually an immutable sequence type , as documented in Tuples and Sequence Types — list , tuple , range . With arguments `iterable`.

These functions all execute a new program , replacing the current process ; they do not return . The other variants , execl ( ) , execle ( ) , execv ( ) , and execve ( ) , will not use the PATH variable to locate the executable ; `path` must contain an appropriate absolute or relative path . The “ v ” variants are good when the number of parameters is variable , with the arguments being passed in a list or tuple as the `args` parameter . For execle ( ) , execlpe ( ) , execve ( ) , and execvpe ( ) ( note that these all end in “ e ” ) , the `env` parameter must be a mapping which is used to define the environment variables for the new process ( these are used instead of the current process ’ environment ) ; the functions execl ( ) , execlp ( ) , execv ( ) , and execvp ( ) all cause the new process to inherit the environment of the current process .

This method makes a backup of a SQLite database even while it ’ s being accessed by other clients , or concurrently by the same connection . The `filename` argument should give the file from which the code was read ; pass some recognizable value if it wasn ’ t read from a file ( ' < string > ' is commonly used ) . The `mode` argument specifies what kind of code must be compiled ; it can be 'exec ' if source consists of a sequence of statements , 'eval ' if it consists of a single expression , or 'single ' if it consists of a single interactive statement ( in the latter case , expression statements that evaluate to something other than None will be printed ) .

snippet: sqlite3.connect(database, timeout, detect_types, isolation_level, check_same_thread, factory, cached_statements)
intent: Opens a connection to the SQLite `database` file database . The `timeout` parameter specifies how long the connection should wait for the lock to go away until raising an exception . The `detect_types` parameter and the using custom converters registered with the module-level register_converter ( ) function allow you to easily do that . For the `isolation_level` parameter , please see the isolation_level property of Connection objects . By default , `check_same_thread` is True and only the creating thread may use the connection . By default returns a Connection object , unless a custom `factory` is given . If you want to explicitly set the number of statements that are cached for the connection , you can set the `cached_statements` parameter .
Return the current contents of history item at `index` .
Open `file` and return a corresponding file object . `errors` is an optional string that specifies how encoding and decoding errors are to be handled—this can not be used in binary mode .
Set `loop` as a current event loop for the current OS thread .

This method makes a backup of a SQLite database even while it ’ s being accessed by other clients , or concurrently by the same connection . The copy will be written into the mandatory argument `target` , that must be another Connection instance . The `name` argument specifies the database name that will be copied : it must be a string containing either `` main '' , the default , to indicate the main database , `` temp '' to indicate the temporary database or the name specified after the AS keyword in an ATTACH DATABASE statement for an attached database .

Execute the program `path` in a new process . If `mode` is P_NOWAIT , this function returns the process id of the new process ; if mode is P_WAIT , returns the process ’ s exit code if it exits normally , or -signal , where signal is the signal that killed the process . For spawnle ( ) , spawnlpe ( ) , spawnve ( ) , and spawnvpe ( ) ( note that these all end in “ e ” ) , the `env` parameter must be a mapping which is used to define the environment variables for the new process ( they are used instead of the current process ’ environment ) ; the functions spawnl ( ) , spawnlp ( ) , spawnv ( ) , and spawnvp ( ) all cause the new process to inherit the environment of the current process .

Many programs split up their functionality into a number of sub-commands , for example , the svn program can invoke sub-commands like svn checkout , svn update , and svn commit . The add_subparsers ( ) method also supports `title` and `description` keyword arguments .

Schedule a new event . The `time` `argument` should be a numeric type compatible with the return value of the timefunc function passed to the constructor . Events scheduled for the same time will be executed in the order of their `priority` . Executing the event means executing `action` ( *argument , **kwargs ) .
Create a Timer instance with the given statement , `setup` code and `timer` function and run its timeit ( ) method with `number` executions . With arguments `stmt`.

The `compresslevel` argument is an integer from 0 to 9 , as for the GzipFile constructor .

numeric code for operation, corresponding to the opcode values listed below and the bytecode values in the Opcode collections.
Base class for C callable foreign functions.

Returns an approximation of the Header as a string , using an unlimited line length .
Called when a connection is made . The `transport` argument is the transport representing the connection .

For existing code calling readfp ( ) with arguments which don ’ t support iteration , the following generator may be used as a wrapper around the file-like object : Instead of parser.readfp ( `fp` ) use parser.read_file ( readline_generator ( fp ) ) . With arguments `filename`.

Insert an entry into the list of warnings filter specifications . With arguments `action`, `category`.

This function operates exactly as TemporaryFile ( ) does , except that the file is guaranteed to have a visible name in the file system ( on Unix , the directory entry is not unlinked ) . If `delete` is true ( the default ) , the file is deleted as soon as it is closed .
Bind `fun` to mouse-click events on this turtle . With arguments `add`.

Open a bzip2-compressed file in binary or text `mode` , returning a file object . As with the constructor for BZ2File , the `filename` argument can be an actual filename ( a str or bytes object ) , or an existing file object to read from or write to . In this case , the `encoding` , `errors` and `newline` arguments must not be provided .
For a datetime instance d , str ( d ) is equivalent to d.isoformat ( ' ' ) .

Return a m-column calendar for an entire year as a multi-line string . Optional parameters `w` , `l` , and `c` are for date column width , lines per week , and number of spaces between month columns , respectively . With arguments `theyear`.

Return a copy of the string where all tab characters are replaced by one or more spaces , depending on the current column and the given tab size . Tab positions occur every `tabsize` characters ( default is 8 , giving tab positions at columns 0 , 8 , 16 and so on ) .

Return a new sorted list from the items in `iterable` . `key` specifies a function of one argument that is used to extract a comparison key from each element in iterable ( for example , key=str.lower ) . `reverse` is a boolean value .

Locate the insertion point for `x` in `a` to maintain sorted order . The parameters `lo` and `hi` may be used to specify a subset of the list which should be considered ; by default the entire list is used .
Return a guess for whether wsgi.url_scheme should be “ http ” or “ https ” , by checking for a HTTPS environment variable in the `environ` dictionary .

Return a 2-tuple ; the first element is a string containing the command line to be executed ( which can be passed to os.system ( ) ) , and the second element is the mailcap entry for a given MIME type . `key` is the name of the field desired , which represents the type of activity to be performed ; the default value is ‘ view ’ , since in the most common case you simply want to view the body of the MIME-typed data . With arguments `caps`.

Return an integer object constructed from a number or string `x` , or return 0 if no arguments are given . If x is not a number or if `base` is given , then x must be a string , bytes , or bytearray instance representing an integer literal in radix base .

Test that `first` and `second` are approximately ( or not approximately ) equal by computing the difference , rounding to the given number of decimal `places` ( default 7 ) , and comparing to zero . If `delta` is supplied instead of places then the difference between first and second must be less or equal to ( or greater than ) delta .

Convert a mapping object or a sequence of two-element tuples , which may contain str or bytes objects , to a percent-encoded ASCII text string . When a sequence of two-element tuples is used as the `query` argument , the first element of each tuple is a key and the second is a value . The value element in itself can be a sequence and in that case , if the optional parameter `doseq` is evaluates to True , individual key=value pairs separated by ' & ' are generated for each element of the value sequence for the key . For maximum control of what is quoted , use quote and specify a value for `safe` .

Compile the `source` into a code or AST object . The `filename` argument should give the file from which the code was read ; pass some recognizable value if it wasn ’ t read from a file ( ' < string > ' is commonly used ) . The `mode` argument specifies what kind of code must be compiled ; it can be 'exec ' if source consists of a sequence of statements , 'eval ' if it consists of a single expression , or 'single ' if it consists of a single interactive statement ( in the latter case , expression statements that evaluate to something other than None will be printed ) . The optional arguments `flags` and `dont_inherit` control which future statements affect the compilation of source .

This function operates exactly as TemporaryFile ( ) does , except that data is spooled in memory until the file size exceeds `max_size` , or until the file ’ s fileno ( ) method is called , at which point the contents are written to disk and operation proceeds as with TemporaryFile ( ) . This method makes a backup of a SQLite database even while it ’ s being accessed by other clients , or concurrently by the same connection . The copy will be written into the mandatory argument `target` , that must be another Connection instance . By default , or when `pages` is either 0 or a negative integer , the entire database is copied in a single step ; otherwise the method performs a loop copying up to pages pages at a time . The `name` argument specifies the database name that will be copied : it must be a string containing either `` main '' , the default , to indicate the main database , `` temp '' to indicate the temporary database or the name specified after the AS keyword in an ATTACH DATABASE statement for an attached database .

snippet: sqlite3.connect(database, timeout, detect_types, isolation_level, check_same_thread, factory, cached_statements, uri)
intent: Opens a connection to the SQLite `database` file database . The `timeout` parameter specifies how long the connection should wait for the lock to go away until raising an exception . The `detect_types` parameter and the using custom converters registered with the module-level register_converter ( ) function allow you to easily do that . For the `isolation_level` parameter , please see the isolation_level property of Connection objects . By default , `check_same_thread` is True and only the creating thread may use the connection . By default returns a Connection object , unless a custom `factory` is given . If you want to explicitly set the number of statements that are cached for the connection , you can set the `cached_statements` parameter . If `uri` is true , database is interpreted as a URI .
Called by the parser to give the application a `locator` for locating the origin of document events .

When a header parameter is encoded in RFC 2231 format , Message.get_param may return a 3-tuple containing the character set , language , and `value` . Packs a fixed length list ( `array` ) of homogeneous items . `n` is the length of the list ; it is not packed into the buffer , but a ValueError exception is raised if len ( array ) is not equal to n. As above , `pack_item` is the function used to pack each element .

This method makes a backup of a SQLite database even while it ’ s being accessed by other clients , or concurrently by the same connection . The copy will be written into the mandatory argument `target` , that must be another Connection instance . By default , or when `pages` is either 0 or a negative integer , the entire database is copied in a single step ; otherwise the method performs a loop copying up to pages pages at a time . The `name` argument specifies the database name that will be copied : it must be a string containing either `` main '' , the default , to indicate the main database , `` temp '' to indicate the temporary database or the name specified after the AS keyword in an ATTACH DATABASE statement for an attached database .
