These functions all execute a new program , replacing the current process ; they do not return . The other variants , execl ( ) , execle ( ) , execv ( ) , and execve ( ) , will not use the PATH variable to locate the executable ; `path` must contain an appropriate absolute or relative path . The “ v ” variants are good when the number of parameters is variable , with the arguments being passed in a list or tuple as the `args` parameter . For execle ( ) , execlpe ( ) , execve ( ) , and execvpe ( ) ( note that these all end in “ e ” ) , the `env` parameter must be a mapping which is used to define the environment variables for the new process ( these are used instead of the current process ’ environment ) ; the functions execl ( ) , execlp ( ) , execv ( ) , and execvp ( ) all cause the new process to inherit the environment of the current process .
Called when a connection is made . The `transport` argument is the transport representing the connection .
Given the address `addr` of an SSL-protected server , as a ( hostname , port-number ) pair , fetches the server ’ s certificate , and returns it as a PEM-encoded string .

The optional `restval` parameter specifies the value to be written if the dictionary is missing a key in fieldnames . If the dictionary passed to the writerow ( ) method contains a key not found in fieldnames , the optional `extrasaction` parameter indicates what action to take . Return a m-column calendar for an entire year as a multi-line string . Optional parameters `w` , `l` , and `c` are for date column width , lines per week , and number of spaces between month columns , respectively . With arguments `theyear`.
Call this function to specify a recording source . Returns a `bitmask` indicating the new recording source ( or sources ) if successful ; raises OSError if an invalid source was specified .

Open a gzip-compressed file in binary or text `mode` , returning a file object . The `filename` argument can be an actual filename ( a str or bytes object ) , or an existing file object to read from or write to . `name` and `value` are passed to BaseHeader from the header_factory call .

Returns a date string as per RFC 2822 , e.g . Optional `timeval` if given is a floating point time value as accepted by time.gmtime ( ) and time.localtime ( ) , otherwise the current time is used . Optional `localtime` is a flag that when True , interprets timeval , and returns a date relative to the local timezone instead of UTC , properly taking daylight savings time into account . Optional `usegmt` is a flag that when True , outputs a date string with the timezone as an ascii string GMT , rather than a numeric -0000 .

snippet: msilib.Directory(database, cab, basedir, physical, logical, default)
intent: Create a new directory in the Directory table . Files are added into the current component , and into the `cab` file . To create a directory , a base directory object needs to be specified ( can be None ) , the path to the `physical` directory , and a `logical` directory name . `default` specifies the DefaultDir slot in the directory table . With arguments `database`, `basedir`.
Asynchronous version of socket.getaddrinfo ( ) . With arguments `host`, `port`.

Allows intercepting creation of coroutine objects ( only ones that are created by an async def function ; generators decorated with types.coroutine ( ) or asyncio.coroutine ( ) will not be intercepted ) . The `wrapper` argument must be either :

Load configuration from any object that provides a dict-like items ( ) method . If the used `dictionary` type preserves order , sections and their keys will be added in order . Optional argument `source` specifies a context-specific name of the dictionary passed .

Append a new item with value `x` to the end of the array .
Returns input_charset as a string coerced to lower case .

Called for each declared attribute for an element `type` . `elname` is the name of the element to which the declaration applies and `attname` is the name of the attribute declared . The attribute type is a string passed as type ; the possible values are 'CDATA ' , 'ID ' , 'IDREF ' , … `default` gives the default value for the attribute used when the attribute is not specified by the document instance , or None if there is no default value ( # IMPLIED values ) . If the attribute is `required` to be given in the document instance , required will be true .

Recursively copy an entire directory tree rooted at `src` , returning the destination directory . The destination directory , named by `dst` , must not already exist ; it will be created as well as missing parent directories . If `symlinks` is true , symbolic links in the source tree are represented as symbolic links in the new tree and the metadata of the original links will be copied as far as the platform allows ; if false or omitted , the contents and metadata of the linked files are copied to the new tree . If `ignore` is given , it must be a callable that will receive as its arguments the directory being visited by copytree ( ) , and a list of its contents , as returned by os.listdir ( ) .

The optional `restval` parameter specifies the value to be written if the dictionary is missing a key in fieldnames . If the dictionary passed to the writerow ( ) method contains a key not found in fieldnames , the optional `extrasaction` parameter indicates what action to take . With arguments `f`, `*args`, `**kwds`.

Establish a network connection and return a pair of ( reader , writer ) objects . With arguments `family`.

Issue a warning , or maybe ignore it or raise an exception . Alternatively `message` can be a Warning instance , in which case category will be ignored and message.__class__ will be used . The `stacklevel` argument can be used by wrapper functions written in Python , like this :

These functions all execute a new program , replacing the current process ; they do not return . The other variants , execl ( ) , execle ( ) , execv ( ) , and execve ( ) , will not use the PATH variable to locate the executable ; `path` must contain an appropriate absolute or relative path . The “ v ” variants are good when the number of parameters is variable , with the arguments being passed in a list or tuple as the `args` parameter . For execle ( ) , execlpe ( ) , execve ( ) , and execvpe ( ) ( note that these all end in “ e ” ) , the `env` parameter must be a mapping which is used to define the environment variables for the new process ( these are used instead of the current process ’ environment ) ; the functions execl ( ) , execlp ( ) , execv ( ) , and execvp ( ) all cause the new process to inherit the environment of the current process .

The `mode` argument specifies what kind of code must be compiled ; it can be 'exec ' if source consists of a sequence of statements , 'eval ' if it consists of a single expression , or 'single ' if it consists of a single interactive statement ( in the latter case , expression statements that evaluate to something other than None will be printed ) . The optional arguments `flags` and `dont_inherit` control which future statements affect the compilation of source .

Compresses the bytes in `data` , returning a bytes object containing compressed data . `level` is an integer from 0 to 9 or -1 controlling the level of compression ; 1 ( Z_BEST_SPEED ) is fastest and produces the least compression , 9 ( Z_BEST_COMPRESSION ) is slowest and produces the most .

snippet: sqlite3.connect(database, timeout, detect_types, isolation_level, check_same_thread, factory, cached_statements)
intent: Opens a connection to the SQLite `database` file database . The `timeout` parameter specifies how long the connection should wait for the lock to go away until raising an exception . The `detect_types` parameter and the using custom converters registered with the module-level register_converter ( ) function allow you to easily do that . For the `isolation_level` parameter , please see the isolation_level property of Connection objects . By default , `check_same_thread` is True and only the creating thread may use the connection . By default returns a Connection object , unless a custom `factory` is given . If you want to explicitly set the number of statements that are cached for the connection , you can set the `cached_statements` parameter .
Sets the `target` handler for this handler .
Set ANNOTATIONs for `mailbox` . With arguments `entry`.

These functions all execute a new program , replacing the current process ; they do not return . The other variants , execl ( ) , execle ( ) , execv ( ) , and execve ( ) , will not use the PATH variable to locate the executable ; `path` must contain an appropriate absolute or relative path . The “ v ” variants are good when the number of parameters is variable , with the arguments being passed in a list or tuple as the `args` parameter . For execle ( ) , execlpe ( ) , execve ( ) , and execvpe ( ) ( note that these all end in “ e ” ) , the `env` parameter must be a mapping which is used to define the environment variables for the new process ( these are used instead of the current process ’ environment ) ; the functions execl ( ) , execlp ( ) , execv ( ) , and execvp ( ) all cause the new process to inherit the environment of the current process .

snippet: sqlite3.connect(database, timeout, detect_types, isolation_level, check_same_thread, factory, cached_statements, uri)
intent: Opens a connection to the SQLite `database` file database . The `timeout` parameter specifies how long the connection should wait for the lock to go away until raising an exception . The `detect_types` parameter and the using custom converters registered with the module-level register_converter ( ) function allow you to easily do that . For the `isolation_level` parameter , please see the isolation_level property of Connection objects . By default , `check_same_thread` is True and only the creating thread may use the connection . By default returns a Connection object , unless a custom `factory` is given . If you want to explicitly set the number of statements that are cached for the connection , you can set the `cached_statements` parameter . If `uri` is true , database is interpreted as a URI .

Compile the `source` into a code or AST object . The `filename` argument should give the file from which the code was read ; pass some recognizable value if it wasn ’ t read from a file ( ' < string > ' is commonly used ) . The `mode` argument specifies what kind of code must be compiled ; it can be 'exec ' if source consists of a sequence of statements , 'eval ' if it consists of a single expression , or 'single ' if it consists of a single interactive statement ( in the latter case , expression statements that evaluate to something other than None will be printed ) . The argument `optimize` specifies the optimization level of the compiler ; the default value of -1 selects the optimization level of the interpreter as given by -O options .

Return a reader object which will iterate over lines in the given `csvfile` . With arguments `**fmtparams`.
Maps a logging level name to a syslog priority name . With arguments `levelname`.
Return a new set object , optionally with elements taken from `iterable` .
The Tk class is instantiated without arguments . With arguments `className`.

A shlex instance or subclass instance is a lexical analyzer object . The `posix` argument defines the operational mode : when posix is not true ( default ) , the shlex instance will operate in compatibility mode .
Make an entry into the ControlEvent table for this control . With arguments `event`, `argument`, `ordering`.
Insert a simple entry into the list of warnings filter specifications . With arguments `action`, `lineno`, `append`.
Prints the calendar for an entire `year` as returned by calendar ( ) . With arguments `l`, `m`.
Returns the value specified for `option` in `style` . If `state` is specified , it is expected to be a sequence of one or more states .
Queries the given `executable` ( defaults to the Python interpreter binary ) for various architecture information .

Return a new sorted list from the items in `iterable` . `key` specifies a function of one argument that is used to extract a comparison key from each element in iterable ( for example , key=str.lower ) .
Return the number of variables set in the context object . With arguments `proxy`.
Extract a `member` from the archive to the current working directory , using its full name .

Recursively copy an entire directory tree rooted at `src` , returning the destination directory . The destination directory , named by `dst` , must not already exist ; it will be created as well as missing parent directories . If `symlinks` is true , symbolic links in the source tree are represented as symbolic links in the new tree and the metadata of the original links will be copied as far as the platform allows ; if false or omitted , the contents and metadata of the linked files are copied to the new tree . If `ignore` is given , it must be a callable that will receive as its arguments the directory being visited by copytree ( ) , and a list of its contents , as returned by os.listdir ( ) .
There are three different ways to call this function : Add a turtle `shape` to TurtleScreen ’ s shapelist . With arguments `name`.
A ChainMap groups multiple dicts or other mappings together to create a single , updateable view . With arguments `*maps`.
Generate a CAB file , add it as a stream to the MSI file , put it into the Media table , and remove the generated file from the disk . With arguments `database`.

Load a module that was previously found by find_module ( ) ( or by an otherwise conducted search yielding compatible results ) . The `name` argument indicates the full module name ( including the package name , if this is a submodule of a package ) . The `file` argument is an open file , and `pathname` is the corresponding file name ; these can be None and `` , respectively , when the module is a package or not being loaded from a file . The `description` argument is a tuple , as would be returned by get_suffixes ( ) , describing what kind of module must be loaded .
A class to handle opening of HTTPS URLs . With arguments `debuglevel`.
Called when the child process writes `data` into its stdout or stderr pipe . `fd` is the integer file descriptor of the pipe .
Called for the start of every element . `name` is a string containing the element name , and `attributes` is the element attributes .
Clean up indentation from docstrings that are indented to line up with blocks of code . With arguments `doc`.
Perform the operation `cmd` on file descriptor `fd` ( file objects providing a fileno ( ) method are accepted as well ) .
This function returns an object that describes the resources consumed by either the current process or its children , as specified by the `who` parameter .

Optional argument `isjunk` must be None ( the default ) or `a` one-argument function that takes a sequence element and returns true if and only if the element is “ junk ” and should be ignored . The optional arguments a and `b` are sequences to be compared ; both default to empty strings .
Fused multiply-add . With arguments `other`, `third`.

Constructor for the GzipFile class , which simulates most of the methods of a file object , with the exception of the truncate ( ) method . The `compresslevel` argument is an integer from 0 to 9 controlling the level of compression ; 1 is fastest and produces the least compression , and 9 is slowest and produces the most compression .

Take two ( non complex ) numbers as arguments and return `a` pair of numbers consisting of their quotient and remainder when using integer division . For integers , the result is the same as ( a // `b` , a % b ) .
Raised when an assert statement fails.
Decorator to wrap a function with a memoizing callable that saves up to the `maxsize` most recent calls .
If the `prompt` argument is present , it is written to standard output without a trailing newline .

Make an iterator that returns evenly spaced values starting with number `start` . When counting with floating point numbers , better accuracy can sometimes be achieved by substituting multiplicative code such as : ( start + `step` * i for i in count ( ) ) .
Creates or opens the specified `key` , returning a handle object . `sub_key` is a string that names the key this method opens or creates . `reserved` is a reserved integer , and must be zero .
Return a slice object representing the set of indices specified by range ( start , `stop` , step ) .

Return a new “ bytes ” object , which is an immutable sequence of integers in the range 0 < = x < 256. bytes is an immutable version of bytearray – it has the same non-mutating methods and the same indexing and slicing behavior . With arguments `source`, `encoding`.
Fused multiply-add . With arguments `other`, `third`.

Return a 2-tuple ; the first element is a string containing the command line to be executed ( which can be passed to os.system ( ) ) , and the second element is the mailcap entry for a given MIME type . With arguments `caps`.
Parse the `source` into an AST node . Equivalent to compile ( source , `filename` , `mode` , ast.PyCF_ONLY_AST ) .
Initialize the random number generator . If `a` is omitted or None , the current system time is used .
Sends `data` to the remote server .

Return the docstring of the given `node` ( which must be a FunctionDef , AsyncFunctionDef , ClassDef , or Module node ) , or None if it has no docstring . If `clean` is true , clean up the docstring ’ s indentation with inspect.cleandoc ( ) .
Returns a new instance of the NTEventLogHandler class . The `appname` is used to define the application name as it appears in the event log .
A condition variable : an alias for threading.Condition . If `lock` is specified then it should be a Lock or RLock object from multiprocessing .
Create a turtle . With arguments `canvas`.
Return True if both pathname arguments refer to the same file or directory . With arguments `path1`, `path2`.
Print objects to the text stream `file` , separated by `sep` and followed by `end` . With arguments `*objects`.
Return True if the file system for `directory` is case-insensitive .
Returns a new instance of the QueueHandler class . The instance is initialized with the `queue` to send messages to .
Creates a new dataclass with name `cls_name` , `fields` as defined in fields , base classes as given in `bases` , and initialized with a `namespace` as given in namespace .
Return a value for the context variable for the current context . With arguments `default`.
Instances of this class represent loaded shared libraries . With arguments `name`, `use_errno`.
Make an iterator that aggregates elements from each of the iterables . With arguments `*iterables`.
Set a task `factory` that will be used by loop.create_task ( ) .
Enters a new context manager and adds its __exit__ ( ) method to the callback stack . With arguments `cm`.
List mailbox names in `directory` matching `pattern` .

This function causes the cgitb module to take over the interpreter ’ s default handling for exceptions by setting the value of sys.excepthook . If the optional argument `format` is `` html '' , the output is formatted as HTML .

Decode the Ascii85 encoded bytes-like object or ASCII string `b` and return the decoded bytes . `ignorechars` should be a bytes-like object or ASCII string containing characters to ignore from the input .
Shut down one or both halves of the connection . If `how` is SHUT_RD , further receives are disallowed .
Set the environment variable named `key` to the string `value` .

Enable or disable automatic calls to add_history ( ) when reading input via readline . The `enabled` argument should be a Boolean value that when true , enables auto history , and that when false , disables auto history .

Return a file-like object that can be used as a temporary storage area . The `mode` parameter defaults to ' w+b ' so that the file created can be read and written without being closed . `buffering` , `encoding` and `newline` are interpreted as for open ( ) .
This function supports dynamic execution of Python code . `object` must be either a string or a code object .
Open an LZMA-compressed file in binary `mode` . In this case , the `check` and `preset` arguments should not be used .

Issue a warning , or maybe ignore it or raise an exception . Alternatively `message` can be a Warning instance , in which case category will be ignored and message.__class__ will be used . The `stacklevel` argument can be used by wrapper functions written in Python , like this :

Starts up a socket server on the specified `port` , and listens for new configurations . The `verify` argument , if specified , should be a callable which should verify whether bytes received across the socket are valid and should be processed .

snippet: sqlite3.connect(database, timeout, detect_types, isolation_level, check_same_thread, factory, cached_statements)
intent: Opens a connection to the SQLite `database` file database . The `timeout` parameter specifies how long the connection should wait for the lock to go away until raising an exception . The `detect_types` parameter and the using custom converters registered with the module-level register_converter ( ) function allow you to easily do that . For the `isolation_level` parameter , please see the isolation_level property of Connection objects . By default , `check_same_thread` is True and only the creating thread may use the connection . By default returns a Connection object , unless a custom `factory` is given . If you want to explicitly set the number of statements that are cached for the connection , you can set the `cached_statements` parameter .
Open `file` and return a corresponding file object .
Sets the data buffer unpack `position` to position .
Start a new thread and return its identifier . The thread executes the `function` function with the argument list `args` ( which must be a tuple ) .

Return a new sorted list from the items in `iterable` . `key` specifies a function of one argument that is used to extract a comparison key from each element in iterable ( for example , key=str.lower ) . `reverse` is a boolean value .
Return a Maildir instance representing the `folder` whose name is folder .
Instances of this class represent loaded shared libraries . With arguments `name`, `use_errno`.
Register the read end of `pipe` in the event loop . `protocol_factory` must be a callable returning an asyncio protocol implementation .

Set a parameter in the Content-Type `header` . If the parameter already exists in the header , its `value` will be replaced with value . Optional `language` specifies the RFC 2231 language , defaulting to the empty string . With arguments `param`.
Sets the terminating condition to be recognized on the channel . `term` may be any of three types of value , corresponding to three different ways to handle incoming protocol data .
Retrieve the next item from the `iterator` by calling its __next__ ( ) method . If `default` is given , it is returned if the iterator is exhausted , otherwise StopIteration is raised .
This is identical to m.group ( `g` ) .
Add a `function` to be called after tearDown ( ) to cleanup resources used during the test . With arguments `*args`, `**kwargs`.

Run the `cmd` shell command . The `limit` argument sets the buffer limit for StreamReader wrappers for Process.stdout and Process.stderr ( if subprocess.PIPE is passed to `stdout` and `stderr` arguments ) . With arguments `**kwds`.
A condition variable : an alias for threading.Condition . If `lock` is specified then it should be a Lock or RLock object from multiprocessing .
Return a `fragment` that has all samples in the original fragment multiplied by the floating-point value `factor` . With arguments `width`.
( Only supported on BSD . ) With arguments `ident`, `filter`, `data`.
Set `executor` as the default executor used by run_in_executor ( ) .
Set the main `type` and subtype for the Content-Type `header` . If `requote` is False , this leaves the existing header ’ s quoting as is , otherwise the parameters will be quoted ( the default ) .
All arguments are optional . With arguments `minute`.
Set the size and position of the main window . With arguments `width`.
Example : With arguments `poly`, `fill`, `outline`.
Extensible JSON encoder for Python data structures . If specified , `separators` should be an ( item_separator , key_separator ) tuple .
Draw a border around the edges of the window . With arguments `ls`.

Beep the PC ’ s speaker . The `frequency` parameter specifies frequency , in hertz , of the sound , and must be in the range 37 through 32,767 . The `duration` parameter specifies the number of milliseconds the sound should last .
A factory function for creating a ModuleSpec instance based on the path to a file . With arguments `name`, `location`.
Only available on Windows.
Convert binary `data` to a line of ASCII characters , the return value is the converted line , including a newline char . If `backtick` is true , zeros are represented by ' ` ' instead of spaces .
This iterates over all the subparts of `msg` , returning only those subparts that match the MIME type specified by `maintype` and `subtype` .
Shut down one or both halves of the connection . If `how` is SHUT_RD , further receives are disallowed .

Return the largest item in an iterable or the largest of two or more arguments . The `key` argument specifies a one-argument ordering function like that used for list.sort ( ) . With arguments `arg1`, `arg2`, `*args`.

Load configuration from any object that provides a dict-like items ( ) method . If the used `dictionary` type preserves order , sections and their keys will be added in order . Optional argument `source` specifies a context-specific name of the dictionary passed .

Call the underlying PlaySound ( ) function from the Platform API . The `sound` parameter may be a filename , a system sound alias , audio data as a bytes-like object , or None . Its interpretation depends on the value of `flags` , which can be a bitwise ORed combination of the constants described below .
Set the size and position of the main window . With arguments `width`, `height`.
Return the number of items in the dictionary `d` .

With one argument , return the type of an object . The `name` string is the class name and becomes the __name__ attribute ; the `bases` tuple itemizes the base classes and becomes the __bases__ attribute ; and the `dict` dictionary is the namespace containing definitions for class body and is copied to a standard dictionary to become the __dict__ attribute .
Return the string obtained by doing backslash substitution on the `template` string template , as done by the sub ( ) method .
Set the cursor state . `visibility` can be set to 0 , 1 , or 2 , for invisible , normal , or very visible .
Append a new item with value `x` to the end of the array .
Fetch ( parts of ) messages . `message_parts` should be a string of message part names enclosed within parentheses , eg : `` ( UID BODY [ TEXT ] ) '' . With arguments `message_set`.
Read at most `size` bytes from the chunk ( less if the read hits the end of the chunk before obtaining size bytes ) .
Create a Timer instance with the given statement , `setup` code and `timer` function and run its timeit ( ) method with `number` executions . With arguments `stmt`.
Parse the `source` into an AST node . Equivalent to compile ( source , `filename` , `mode` , ast.PyCF_ONLY_AST ) .
If the `prompt` argument is present , it is written to standard output without a trailing newline .
Create a Stats object based on the current profile and print the results to stdout . With arguments `sort`.
This is identical to m.group ( `g` ) .

Outputs a symbolic disassembly of the `pickle` to the file-like object `out` , defaulting to sys.stdout . Successive levels , indicated by MARK opcodes in the stream , are indented by `indentlevel` spaces .

Return a new “ bytes ” object , which is an immutable sequence of integers in the range 0 < = x < 256. bytes is an immutable version of bytearray – it has the same non-mutating methods and the same indexing and slicing behavior . With arguments `source`, `encoding`.

Split the string `s` using shell-like syntax . If `comments` is False ( the default ) , the parsing of comments in the given string will be disabled ( setting the commenters attribute of the shlex instance to the empty string ) . This function operates in POSIX mode by default , but uses non-POSIX mode if the `posix` argument is false .
Set the current numeric umask and return the previous umask . With arguments `mask`.
Return a copy of the string in which each character has been mapped through the given translation `table` .
Return a TarFile object for the pathname `name` . With arguments `**kwargs`.

The arguments are a string and optional `globals` and `locals` . The `expression` argument is parsed and evaluated as a Python expression ( technically speaking , a condition list ) using the globals and locals dictionaries as global and local namespace .
Prints the calendar for an entire `year` as returned by calendar ( ) . With arguments `w`.
Set the main `type` and subtype for the Content-Type `header` .
Returns the number of leap years in the range from `y1` to `y2` ( exclusive ) , where y1 and y2 are years .
Register `func` as a function to be executed at termination . With arguments `*args`, `**kwargs`.

A buffered I/O object combining two unidirectional RawIOBase objects – one readable , the other writeable – into a single bidirectional endpoint . `reader` and `writer` are RawIOBase objects that are readable and writeable respectively .
All arguments are optional and default to 0 . Only `days` , `seconds` and `microseconds` are stored internally .
Bind `fun` to mouse-click events on this turtle . With arguments `btn`, `add`.
Set a task `factory` that will be used by loop.create_task ( ) .
Raised when a mapping (dictionary) key is not found in the set of existing keys.

Set a parameter in the Content-Type `header` . If the parameter already exists in the header , its `value` will be replaced with value . Optional `language` specifies the RFC 2231 language , defaulting to the empty string . With arguments `param`.
Wait for the Future instances ( possibly created by different Executor instances ) given by `fs` to complete .
Increment the line number of each `node` in the tree starting at node by n. This is useful to “ move code ” to a different location in a file . With arguments `n`.

Return a new sorted list from the items in `iterable` . `key` specifies a function of one argument that is used to extract a comparison key from each element in iterable ( for example , key=str.lower ) . `reverse` is a boolean value .
Return an open file object connected to the file descriptor `fd` . With arguments `*args`, `**kwargs`.

snippet: sqlite3.connect(database, timeout, detect_types, isolation_level, check_same_thread, factory, cached_statements)
intent: Opens a connection to the SQLite `database` file database . The `timeout` parameter specifies how long the connection should wait for the lock to go away until raising an exception . The `detect_types` parameter and the using custom converters registered with the module-level register_converter ( ) function allow you to easily do that . For the `isolation_level` parameter , please see the isolation_level property of Connection objects . By default , `check_same_thread` is True and only the creating thread may use the connection . By default returns a Connection object , unless a custom `factory` is given . If you want to explicitly set the number of statements that are cached for the connection , you can set the `cached_statements` parameter .

Return a m-column calendar for an entire year as a multi-line string . Optional parameters `w` , `l` , and `c` are for date column width , lines per week , and number of spaces between month columns , respectively . With arguments `theyear`.
Translate a host name to IPv4 address format . With arguments `hostname`.
Invoke the built-in help system .
Wrap the BIO objects `incoming` and `outgoing` and return an instance of SSLContext.sslobject_class ( default SSLObject ) .

Return a value equal to the first operand after `rounding` and having the exponent of the second operand . With arguments `exp`.

Returns a new instance of the TimedRotatingFileHandler class . On rotating it also sets the `filename` suffix . Rotating happens based on the product of `when` and `interval` .

Packs a fixed length string , s. `n` is the length of the string but it is not packed into the data buffer . With arguments `s`.

Return True if the values `a` and `b` are close to each other and False otherwise . `rel_tol` is the relative tolerance – it is the maximum allowed difference between a and b , relative to the larger absolute value of a or b .
Set a Cookie , without checking with policy to see whether or not it should be set . With arguments `cookie`.
Write `data` to the output file .

Return a callable finalizer object which will be called when `obj` is garbage collected . Calling a live finalizer returns the result of evaluating `func` ( *arg , `**kwargs` ) , whereas calling a dead finalizer returns None . With arguments `*args`.
Rather than being a function , list is actually a mutable sequence type , as documented in Lists and Sequence Types — list , tuple , range . With arguments `iterable`.

Convert binary `data` to a line ( s ) of ASCII characters in quoted-printable encoding . If the optional argument `quotetabs` is present and true , all tabs and spaces will be encoded . If the optional argument `header` is present and true , spaces will be encoded as underscores per RFC 1522 .
Return True if all elements of the `iterable` are true ( or if the iterable is empty ) .
The tuple of base classes of a class object.

Constructor for the GzipFile class , which simulates most of the methods of a file object , with the exception of the truncate ( ) method . At least one of `fileobj` and `filename` must be given a non-trivial value . The `compresslevel` argument is an integer from 0 to 9 controlling the level of compression ; 1 is fastest and produces the least compression , and 9 is slowest and produces the most compression .

Returns a new instance of the HTTPHandler class . The `host` can be of the form host : port , should you need to use a specific port number . With arguments `url`.

The class used to represent an email address . As a convenience `addr_spec` can be specified instead of `username` and `domain` , in which case username and domain will be parsed from the addr_spec .
Return a list of file names as returned by the NLST command . The optional `argument` is a directory to list ( default is the current server directory ) .
This function is a decorator that is used to add generated special methods to classes , as described below . With arguments `init`.

Creates a new dataclass with name `cls_name` , `fields` as defined in fields , base classes as given in `bases` , and initialized with a `namespace` as given in namespace . The values of `init` , `repr` , `eq` , `order` , `unsafe_hash` , and `frozen` have the same meaning as they do in dataclass ( ) .
Convert an integer number to an octal string prefixed with “ 0o ” . If `x` is not a Python int object , it has to define an __index__ ( ) method that returns an integer .
Create a new WSGI server listening on `host` and `port` , accepting connections for `app` .
Return the value for `key` if key is in the dictionary , else `default` .
Append items from `iterable` to the end of the array .
Create an application archive from `source` . The `target` argument determines where the resulting archive will be written :

Create a subprocess from `cmd` , which can be a str or a bytes string encoded to the filesystem encoding , using the platform ’ s “ shell ” syntax . The `protocol_factory` must be a callable returning a subclass of the SubprocessProtocol class . With arguments `**kwargs`, `stdout`, `stderr`.

This function supports dynamic execution of Python code . `object` must be either a string or a code object . If only `globals` is provided , it must be a dictionary , which will be used for both the global and the local variables .
Return `x` to the power `y` ; if `z` is present , return x to the power y , modulo z ( computed more efficiently than pow ( x , y ) % z ) .
Return the message ’ s Content-Type parameters , as a list . Optional `failobj` is the object to return if there is no Content-Type `header` .

This function is installed as the trace function of debugged frames . The default implementation decides how to dispatch a `frame` , depending on the type of `event` ( passed as a string ) that is about to be executed . The `arg` parameter depends on the previous event .
Set a task `factory` that will be used by loop.create_task ( ) .
This function handles the exception described by `info` ( a 3-tuple containing the result of sys.exc_info ( ) ) , formatting its traceback as text and returning the result as a string .
A class which postpones the execution of the `loader` of a module until the module has an attribute accessed .
A basic test runner implementation that outputs results to a `stream` . With arguments `failfast`.
Retrieve the next item from the `iterator` by calling its __next__ ( ) method .

Legacy variant of the ConfigParser . It has `interpolation` disabled by default and allows for non-string section names , option names , and values via its unsafe add_section and set methods , as well as the legacy defaults= keyword argument handling . With arguments `':')`, `';')`.

A processing class used to extract the DocTests that are relevant to a given object , from its docstring and the docstrings of its contained objects . The optional argument `verbose` can be used to display the objects searched by the finder . The optional argument `parser` specifies the DocTestParser object ( or a drop-in replacement ) that is used to extract doctests from docstrings .

Open an LZMA-compressed file in binary or text `mode` , returning a file object . Debug the doctests for an object . The `module` and `name` arguments are the same as for function testsource ( ) above . Optional argument `pm` controls whether post-mortem debugging is used .

This method makes a backup of a SQLite database even while it ’ s being accessed by other clients , or concurrently by the same connection . The copy will be written into the mandatory argument `target` , that must be another Connection instance . By default , or when `pages` is either 0 or a negative integer , the entire database is copied in a single step ; otherwise the method performs a loop copying up to pages pages at a time .

Load a module that was previously found by find_module ( ) ( or by an otherwise conducted search yielding compatible results ) . The `name` argument indicates the full module name ( including the package name , if this is a submodule of a package ) . The `file` argument is an open file , and `pathname` is the corresponding file name ; these can be None and `` , respectively , when the module is a package or not being loaded from a file . The `description` argument is a tuple , as would be returned by get_suffixes ( ) , describing what kind of module must be loaded .
Retrieve attributes without triggering dynamic lookup via the descriptor protocol , __getattr__ ( ) or __getattribute__ ( ) . With arguments `obj`, `attr`, `default`.

Return a list of the best “ good enough ” matches . `word` is a sequence for which close matches are desired ( typically a string ) , and `possibilities` is a list of sequences against which to match word ( typically a list of strings ) . Optional argument `n` ( default 3 ) is the maximum number of close matches to return ; n must be greater than 0 .

Print up to `limit` stack trace entries ( starting from the invocation point ) if limit is positive . The optional `f` argument can be used to specify an alternate stack frame to start . The optional `file` argument has the same meaning as for print_tb ( ) .

This method makes a backup of a SQLite database even while it ’ s being accessed by other clients , or concurrently by the same connection . The copy will be written into the mandatory argument `target` , that must be another Connection instance . By default , or when `pages` is either 0 or a negative integer , the entire database is copied in a single step ; otherwise the method performs a loop copying up to pages pages at a time . The `name` argument specifies the database name that will be copied : it must be a string containing either `` main '' , the default , to indicate the main database , `` temp '' to indicate the temporary database or the name specified after the AS keyword in an ATTACH DATABASE statement for an attached database .

Generate the file names in a directory tree by walking the tree either top-down or bottom-up . For each directory in the tree rooted at directory `top` ( including top itself ) , it yields a 3-tuple ( dirpath , dirnames , filenames ) . If optional argument `topdown` is True or not specified , the triple for a directory is generated before the triples for any of its subdirectories ( directories are generated top-down ) .

Delete an entire directory tree ; `path` must point to a directory ( but not a symbolic link to a directory ) . If `ignore_errors` is true , errors resulting from failed removals will be ignored ; if false or omitted , such errors are handled by calling a handler specified by `onerror` or , if that is omitted , they raise an exception .

Compile the `source` into a code or AST object . The `filename` argument should give the file from which the code was read ; pass some recognizable value if it wasn ’ t read from a file ( ' < string > ' is commonly used ) . The `mode` argument specifies what kind of code must be compiled ; it can be 'exec ' if source consists of a sequence of statements , 'eval ' if it consists of a single expression , or 'single ' if it consists of a single interactive statement ( in the latter case , expression statements that evaluate to something other than None will be printed ) . The optional arguments `flags` and `dont_inherit` control which future statements affect the compilation of source .

snippet: sqlite3.connect(database, timeout, detect_types, isolation_level, check_same_thread, factory, cached_statements, uri)
intent: Opens a connection to the SQLite `database` file database . The `timeout` parameter specifies how long the connection should wait for the lock to go away until raising an exception . The `detect_types` parameter and the using custom converters registered with the module-level register_converter ( ) function allow you to easily do that . For the `isolation_level` parameter , please see the isolation_level property of Connection objects . By default , `check_same_thread` is True and only the creating thread may use the connection . By default returns a Connection object , unless a custom `factory` is given . If you want to explicitly set the number of statements that are cached for the connection , you can set the `cached_statements` parameter . If `uri` is true , database is interpreted as a URI .
Compress the `data` , returning a bytes object containing the compressed data . `compresslevel` has the same meaning as in the GzipFile constructor above .

snippet: shutil.make_archive(base_name, format, root_dir, base_dir, verbose, dry_run, owner)
intent: Create an archive file ( such as zip or tar ) and return its name . `base_name` is the name of the file to create , including the path , minus any format-specific extension . `format` is the archive format : one of “ zip ” ( if the zlib module is available ) , “ tar ” , “ gztar ” ( if the zlib module is available ) , “ bztar ” ( if the bz2 module is available ) , or “ xztar ” ( if the lzma module is available ) . `root_dir` is a directory that will be the root directory of the archive ; for example , we typically chdir into root_dir before creating the archive . `base_dir` is the directory where we start archiving from ; i.e . The `verbose` argument is unused and deprecated . If `dry_run` is true , no archive is created , but the operations that would be executed are logged to `logger` . `owner` and `group` are used when creating a tar archive .

Return a new featureless object.
This is a relative of setattr ( ) . The arguments are an `object` and a string . The string must be the `name` of one of the object ’ s attributes .
Create a Timer instance with the given statement , `setup` code and `timer` function and run its timeit ( ) method with `number` executions .

snippet: window.border(ls, rs, ts, bs, tl, tr, bl, br)
intent: Draw a border around the edges of the window . With arguments `ls`, `rs`, `ts`, `bs`, `tl`, `tr`, `bl`, `br`.
Debug an expression executed via the eval ( ) function . With arguments `expr`.
The `year` , `month` and `day` arguments are required . With arguments `hour`, `minute`.
Decorator for __repr__ ( ) methods to detect recursive calls within the same thread . If a recursive call is made , the `fillvalue` is returned , otherwise , the usual __repr__ ( ) call is made .
Default loader . `href` is a URL . `parse` is for parse mode either “ xml ” or “ text ” . `encoding` is an optional text encoding .
Initialize the random number generator . With `version` 2 ( the default ) , a str , bytes , or bytearray object gets converted to an int and all of its bits are used .

Make an iterator that returns evenly spaced values starting with number `start` . When counting with floating point numbers , better accuracy can sometimes be achieved by substituting multiplicative code such as : ( start + `step` * i for i in count ( ) ) .
Set the cursor state . `visibility` can be set to 0 , 1 , or 2 , for invisible , normal , or very visible .

Queries the given `executable` ( defaults to the Python interpreter binary ) for various architecture information . Returns a tuple ( `bits` , `linkage` ) which contain information about the bit architecture and the linkage format used for the executable .
Append the string `s` to the MIME header . Optional `errors` is passed as the errors argument to the decode call if s is a byte string .

This class represents an aggregation of individual test cases and test suites . If `tests` is given , it must be an iterable of individual test cases or other test suites that will be used to build the suite initially .
Bind `fun` to mouse-click events on this turtle . With arguments `add`.

Recursive directory or file renaming function . After the rename , directories corresponding to rightmost path segments of the `old` name will be pruned away using removedirs ( ) . Works like rename ( ) , except creation of any intermediate directories needed to make the `new` pathname good is attempted first .
Abstract base class for unions in native byte order . With arguments `*args`, `**kw`.
Return the number of items in the dictionary `d` .

Return the current payload , which will be a list of Message objects when is_multipart ( ) is True , or a string when is_multipart ( ) is False . With optional argument `i` , get_payload ( ) will return the i-th element of the payload , counting from zero , if is_multipart ( ) is True .
Retrieve the next item from the `iterator` by calling its __next__ ( ) method . If `default` is given , it is returned if the iterator is exhausted , otherwise StopIteration is raised .
Return a `k` length list of unique elements chosen from the `population` sequence or set .
Return True if the values `a` and `b` are close to each other and False otherwise .
assert the mock has been called with the specified `calls` .
Returns ( `system` , `release` , `version` ) aliased to common marketing names used for some systems .
Gaussian distribution . `mu` is the mean , and `sigma` is the standard deviation .
Remove the `event` from the queue .
Returns a 3-column calendar for an entire `year` as a multi-line string using the formatyear ( ) of the TextCalendar class . With arguments `w`, `m`.
Run the given subprocess.Popen process until completion and return stdout . With arguments `p`.
Create an object to `trace` execution of a single statement or expression . `timing` enables a timestamp relative to when tracing was started to be displayed .
Set the time of the specified clock `clk_id` . With arguments `time: float`.
Convert doctest tests for a `module` to a unittest.TestSuite . Optional arguments `setUp` , `tearDown` , and optionflags are the same as for function DocFileSuite ( ) above .
Sets the callable `application` as the WSGI application that will receive requests .

Class used to represent information about a member of an archive . `filename` should be the full name of the archive member , and `date_time` should be a tuple containing six fields which describe the time of the last modification to the file ; the fields are described in section ZipInfo Objects . With arguments `1`, `1`, `0`, `0`, `0)`.
Return a date with the same value , except for those parameters given new values by whichever keyword arguments are specified . With arguments `day`.
Return an instance of a dict subclass that has methods specialized for rearranging dictionary order . With arguments `items`.
Write a list of `lines` to the stream .
Decode parameters list according to RFC 2231. `params` is a sequence of 2-tuples containing elements of the form ( content-type , string-value ) .
A process pool object which controls a pool of worker `processes` to which jobs can be submitted .
The class used to represent an email address . As a convenience `addr_spec` can be specified instead of `username` and `domain` , in which case username and domain will be parsed from the addr_spec .

Return a 2-tuple ; the first element is a string containing the command line to be executed ( which can be passed to os.system ( ) ) , and the second element is the mailcap entry for a given MIME type . `filename` is the filename to be substituted for % s in the command line ; the default value is '/dev/null ' which is almost certainly not what you want , so usually you ’ ll override it by specifying a filename . With arguments `caps`.
Construct a PrettyPrinter instance . If `compact` is false ( the default ) each item of a long sequence will be formatted on a separate line .
Return True if the values `a` and `b` are close to each other and False otherwise .
The FileType factory creates objects that can be passed to the type argument of ArgumentParser.add_argument ( ) . With arguments `mode`, `bufsize`.
Return True if d has a key key, else False.
Construct `a` new directory comparison object , to compare the directories a and b. `ignore` is a list of names to ignore , and defaults to filecmp.DEFAULT_IGNORES . With arguments `b`.
Prompt server for an update .
Create a Timer instance with the given statement , `setup` code and `timer` function and run its timeit ( ) method with `number` executions . With arguments `stmt`.
The class used to represent an email address . As a convenience `addr_spec` can be specified instead of `username` and `domain` , in which case username and domain will be parsed from the addr_spec .
Set the size and position of the main window . With arguments `width`, `height`.

This function is a decorator that is used to add generated special methods to classes , as described below . The `order` of the fields in all of the generated methods is the order in which they appear in the class definition .

A process pool object which controls a pool of worker `processes` to which jobs can be submitted . If `initializer` is not None then each worker process will call initializer ( *initargs ) when it starts . `maxtasksperchild` is the number of tasks a worker process can complete before it will exit and be replaced with a fresh worker process , to enable unused resources to be freed . With arguments `initargs`.
Return an integer object constructed from a number or string `x` , or return 0 if no arguments are given .

Load a module that was previously found by find_module ( ) ( or by an otherwise conducted search yielding compatible results ) . The `name` argument indicates the full module name ( including the package name , if this is a submodule of a package ) . The `file` argument is an open file , and `pathname` is the corresponding file name ; these can be None and `` , respectively , when the module is a package or not being loaded from a file . The `description` argument is a tuple , as would be returned by get_suffixes ( ) , describing what kind of module must be loaded .
Add a new attribute node to the element , replacing an existing attribute if necessary if the name attribute matches . If `newAttr` is already in use , InuseAttributeErr will be raised .

Signal the executor that it should free any resources that it is using when the currently pending futures are done executing . If `wait` is True then this method will not return until all the pending futures are done executing and the resources associated with the executor have been freed .

patch ( ) acts as a function decorator , class decorator or a context manager . Inside the body of the function or with statement , the `target` is patched with a `new` object . With arguments `**kwargs`.
Write all elements in `rows` ( an iterable of row objects as described above ) to the writer ’ s file object , formatted according to the current dialect .
Implement this method in a subclass such that it returns a serializable object for `o` , or calls the base implementation ( to raise a TypeError ) .

The function provides scrypt password-based key derivation function as defined in RFC 7914 . `password` and `salt` must be bytes-like objects . `n` is the CPU/Memory cost factor , `r` the block size , `p` parallelization factor and `maxmem` limits memory ( OpenSSL 1.1.0 defaults to 32 MiB ) .
Removes the handler for process with PID equal to `pid` .
Returns an instance of LoggerAdapter initialized with an underlying Logger instance and a dict-like object . With arguments `logger`, `extra`.
Parses an XML document from a `sequence` of string fragments . `parser` is an optional parser instance .
Arrange the given list of `classes` into a hierarchy of nested lists . If the `unique` argument is true , exactly one entry appears in the returned structure for each class in the given list .
Install an OpenerDirector instance as the default global `opener` .

A memoryview and a PEP 3118 `exporter` are equal if their shapes are equivalent and if all corresponding values are equal when the operands ’ respective format codes are interpreted using struct syntax .

Return a possibly-empty list of path names that match `pathname` , which must be a string containing a path specification . If `recursive` is true , the pattern “ ** ” will match any files and zero or more directories , subdirectories and symbolic links to directories .
Return the value of the named attribute of `object` . `name` must be a string .
Return a textbox widget object . The `win` argument should be a curses window object in which the textbox is to be contained .
Same as datetime.strftime ( ) . This makes it possible to specify a `format` string for a datetime object in formatted string literals and when using str.format ( ) .
Shutdown connection to server .
Set the size and position of the main window . With arguments `height`.
Print up to `limit` stack trace entries ( starting from the invocation point ) if limit is positive . The optional `f` argument can be used to specify an alternate stack frame to start .
Update and return a dictionary representing the current local symbol table .
Returns the number of leap years in the range from `y1` to `y2` ( exclusive ) , where y1 and y2 are years .
Run the specified WSGI application , `app` .

Create a UUID from either a string of 32 hexadecimal digits , a string of 16 `bytes` in big-endian order as the bytes argument , a string of 16 bytes in little-endian order as the `bytes_le` argument , a tuple of six integers ( 32-bit time_low , 16-bit time_mid , 16-bit time_hi_version , 8-bit clock_seq_hi_variant , 8-bit clock_seq_low , 48-bit node ) as the `fields` argument , or a single 128-bit integer as the `int` argument . When a string of `hex` digits is given , curly braces , hyphens , and a URN prefix are all optional .
Return a value equal to the first operand after `rounding` and having the exponent of the second operand . With arguments `exp`.

snippet: sqlite3.connect(database, timeout, detect_types, isolation_level, check_same_thread, factory, cached_statements, uri)
intent: Opens a connection to the SQLite `database` file database . The `timeout` parameter specifies how long the connection should wait for the lock to go away until raising an exception . The `detect_types` parameter and the using custom converters registered with the module-level register_converter ( ) function allow you to easily do that . For the `isolation_level` parameter , please see the isolation_level property of Connection objects . By default , `check_same_thread` is True and only the creating thread may use the connection . By default returns a Connection object , unless a custom `factory` is given . If you want to explicitly set the number of statements that are cached for the connection , you can set the `cached_statements` parameter . If `uri` is true , database is interpreted as a URI .
Return the value for `var` if var has the value in the context object . Return `default` otherwise .
Register a file object for selection , monitoring it for I/O `events` . `fileobj` is the file object to monitor .

Return a complex number with the value `real` + imag*1j or convert a string or number to a complex number . If `imag` is omitted , it defaults to zero and the constructor serves as a numeric conversion like int and float .
A helper function to indicate a distinct types to a typechecker , see NewType . With arguments `typ`.
Return a Boolean value , i.e .

Return a list of the best “ good enough ” matches . `word` is a sequence for which close matches are desired ( typically a string ) , and `possibilities` is a list of sequences against which to match word ( typically a list of strings ) . Optional argument `cutoff` ( default 0.6 ) is a float in the range [ 0 , 1 ] .

Call the underlying PlaySound ( ) function from the Platform API . The `sound` parameter may be a filename , a system sound alias , audio data as a bytes-like object , or None . Its interpretation depends on the value of `flags` , which can be a bitwise ORed combination of the constants described below .

snippet: ArgumentParser.add_argument(name or flags..., action, nargs, const, default, type, choices)
intent: Define how a single command-line argument should be parsed . With arguments `name or flags...`, `action`, `nargs`, `const`, `default`, `type`, `choices`.
Make an entry into the ControlEvent table for this control . With arguments `event`, `argument`, `condition`.
Return a new set with elements from the set and all others . With arguments `*others`.
Identical to the pack ( ) function , using the compiled format . With arguments `v1`, `v2`.

With one argument , return the type of an object . The `name` string is the class name and becomes the __name__ attribute ; the `bases` tuple itemizes the base classes and becomes the __bases__ attribute ; and the `dict` dictionary is the namespace containing definitions for class body and is copied to a standard dictionary to become the __dict__ attribute .
Removes the item with the index `i` from the array and returns it .
Return false if cookies should not be returned , given cookie `path` . With arguments `request`.
Finds the first subelement matching `match` .
Asynchronous version of socket.getaddrinfo ( ) . With arguments `host`, `port`.
If the default_factory attribute is None , this raises a KeyError exception with the `key` as argument .
Return a copy of the string in which each character has been mapped through the given translation `table` .
Invoke the built-in help system .

Returns a new instance of the QueueListener class . The instance is initialized with the `queue` to send messages to and a list of handlers which will handle entries placed on the queue . With arguments `*handlers`.
Move the turtle forward by the specified `distance` , in the direction the turtle is headed .
Return the docstring of the given `node` ( which must be a FunctionDef , AsyncFunctionDef , ClassDef , or Module node ) , or None if it has no docstring .
List mailbox names in `directory` matching `pattern` .
This function supports dynamic execution of Python code . `object` must be either a string or a code object .
This function is a decorator that is used to add generated special methods to classes , as described below . With arguments `init`.

Return a copy of the bytes or bytearray object where all bytes occurring in the optional argument `delete` are removed , and the remaining bytes have been mapped through the given translation `table` , which must be a bytes object of length 256 .
Return a new frozenset object , optionally with elements taken from `iterable` .

snippet: hashlib.scrypt(password, salt, n, r, p, dklen=64)
intent: The function provides scrypt password-based key derivation function as defined in RFC 7914 . `password` and `salt` must be bytes-like objects . `n` is the CPU/Memory cost factor , `r` the block size , `p` parallelization factor and `maxmem` limits memory ( OpenSSL 1.1.0 defaults to 32 MiB ) . `dklen` is the length of the derived key .
Create a mapping-like object wrapping `headers` , which must be a list of header name/value tuples as described in PEP 3333 .
Return a list of all the keys used in the dictionary `d` .
If `locale` is given and not None , setlocale ( ) modifies the locale setting for the `category` .
Compose a raw device number from the `major` and `minor` device numbers .

Accepts two optional keyword arguments which are callables that accept an asynchronous generator iterator as an argument . The `firstiter` callable will be called when an asynchronous generator is iterated for the first time . The `finalizer` will be called when an asynchronous generator is about to be garbage collected .
Returns the greatest int < = self .
All built-in, non-system-exiting exceptions are derived from this class.

Open an LZMA-compressed file in binary or text `mode` , returning a file object . The `filename` argument can be either an actual file name ( given as a str , bytes or path-like object ) , in which case the named file is opened , or it can be an existing file object to read from or write to . In this case , the `check` and `preset` arguments should not be used .
Set class that keeps weak references to its `elements` .
Set the current process ’ s user id . With arguments `uid`.
Checks if an object appears to be a valid `element` object .
Create a mapping from positional and keyword arguments to parameters . Returns BoundArguments if `*args` and `**kwargs` match the signature , or raises a TypeError .
Load configuration from any object that provides a dict-like items ( ) method . If the used `dictionary` type preserves order , sections and their keys will be added in order .
Set the `state` of the encoder to state .
Return a controller object for the browser type `using` .

This function supports dynamic execution of Python code . `object` must be either a string or a code object . If only `globals` is provided , it must be a dictionary , which will be used for both the global and the local variables . If globals and `locals` are given , they are used for the global and local variables , respectively .

This function implements the standard .mo file search algorithm . It takes a `domain` , identical to what textdomain ( ) takes . If `all` is given , it returns a list of all file names , in the order in which they appear in the languages list or the environment variables .
The standard formatter . With arguments `writer`.
Set the message ’ s `visible` headers to be the same as the headers in message .

This method sorts the list in place , using only < comparisons between items . `key` specifies a function of one argument that is used to extract a comparison key from each list element ( for example , key=str.lower ) . `reverse` is a boolean value .

Enter a polling loop that terminates after `count` passes or all open channels have been closed . The `timeout` argument sets the timeout parameter for the appropriate select ( ) or poll ( ) call , measured in seconds ; the default is 30 seconds . The `use_poll` parameter , if true , indicates that poll ( ) should be used in preference to select ( ) ( the default is False ) . The `map` parameter is a dictionary whose items are the channels to watch .
Return the value of the var ContextVar variable.
Return True if resize_term ( ) would modify the window structure , False otherwise . With arguments `nlines`, `ncols`.
A ServerProxy instance is an object that manages communication with a remote XML-RPC server . With arguments `uri`.
Receive notification of character data . `content` may be a string or bytes instance ; the expat reader module always produces strings .
Test x for non-membership in s.
This class method constructs a Fraction representing the exact value of `flt` , which must be a float .

Creates a new dataclass with name `cls_name` , `fields` as defined in fields , base classes as given in `bases` , and initialized with a `namespace` as given in namespace . The values of `init` , `repr` , `eq` , `order` , `unsafe_hash` , and `frozen` have the same meaning as they do in dataclass ( ) .
Handle an unparsed entity declaration event . With arguments `name`, `publicId`, `systemId`, `ndata`.
Convert the doctest for an object to a script . Argument `module` is a module object , or dotted `name` of a module , containing the object whose doctests are of interest .
Write `data` to the output file .

An SMTP instance encapsulates an SMTP connection . The optional `timeout` parameter specifies a timeout in seconds for blocking operations like the connection attempt ( if not specified , the global default timeout setting will be used ) . If the optional `host` and `port` parameters are given , the SMTP connect ( ) method is called with those parameters during initialization .
Search mailbox for matching messages . `charset` may be None , in which case no CHARSET will be specified in the request to the server .

Find all the test modules by recursing into subdirectories from the specified start directory , and return a TestSuite object containing them . `start_dir` can be a dotted module name as well as a directory . Only test files that match `pattern` will be loaded .
Set a property through MsiSummaryInfoSetProperty ( ) . `field` can have the same values as in GetProperty ( ) , `value` is the new value of the property .
Mark the Future as done and set its `result` .
The FileType factory creates objects that can be passed to the type argument of ArgumentParser.add_argument ( ) . With arguments `mode`.
Default loader . `href` is a URL . `parse` is for parse mode either “ xml ” or “ text ” .
Delete the breakpoints in `filename` and `lineno` .

The main configuration parser . When `strict` is True ( the default ) , the parser won ’ t allow for any section or option duplicates while reading from a single source ( file , string or dictionary ) , raising DuplicateSectionError or DuplicateOptionError . With arguments `':')`, `';')`.
Decodes data from the stream and returns the resulting object . The `size` argument indicates the approximate maximum number of encoded bytes or code points to read for decoding .
Rather than being a function , list is actually a mutable sequence type , as documented in Lists and Sequence Types — list , tuple , range . With arguments `iterable`.

Open a bzip2-compressed file in binary or text `mode` , returning a file object . As with the constructor for BZ2File , the `filename` argument can be an actual filename ( a str or bytes object ) , or an existing file object to read from or write to .
Compute the stack effect of `opcode` with argument `oparg` .
Receive notification of character data . `content` may be a string or bytes instance ; the expat reader module always produces strings .

An SMTP instance encapsulates an SMTP connection . The optional `timeout` parameter specifies a timeout in seconds for blocking operations like the connection attempt ( if not specified , the global default timeout setting will be used ) . If the optional `host` and `port` parameters are given , the SMTP connect ( ) method is called with those parameters during initialization .
Set the value of `a` at index `b` to `c` .

These functions all execute a new program , replacing the current process ; they do not return . The other variants , execl ( ) , execle ( ) , execv ( ) , and execve ( ) , will not use the PATH variable to locate the executable ; `path` must contain an appropriate absolute or relative path . The “ v ” variants are good when the number of parameters is variable , with the arguments being passed in a list or tuple as the `args` parameter .
Add a new record to the Feature table , using the values `id` , parent.id , `title` , `desc` , `display` , `level` , `directory` , and `attributes` . With arguments `db`.
Update the `is_authenticated` flag for the given `uri` or list of URIs . With arguments `self`.
Bind `fun` to mouse-click events on this turtle . With arguments `btn`.
Return a Boolean value , i.e .
Convert the color from HLS coordinates to RGB coordinates . With arguments `h`, `l`, `s`.
Accept a connection . `sock` must be a non-blocking socket .
Return a complex number with the value `real` + imag*1j or convert a string or number to a complex number .

This class is used to declare a new Context Variable , e.g . The required `name` parameter is used for introspection and debug purposes . The optional keyword-only `default` parameter is returned by ContextVar.get ( ) when no value for the variable is found in the current context .
Subelement factory . `parent` is the parent element . `tag` is the subelement name . With arguments `**extra`.

Return a new instance of the FTP class . When `user` is given , additionally the method call login ( user , `passwd` , `acct` ) is made ( where passwd and acct default to the empty string when not given ) .
Return a floating point number constructed from a number or string `x` .
Read up to `len` bytes of data from the SSL socket and return the result as a bytes instance .
Raised when a local or global name is not found.

Open a ZIP `file` , where file can be a path to a file ( a string ) , a file-like object or a path-like object . `compression` is the ZIP compression method to use when writing the archive , and should be ZIP_STORED , ZIP_DEFLATED , ZIP_BZIP2 or ZIP_LZMA ; unrecognized values will cause NotImplementedError to be raised . If `allowZip64` is True ( the default ) zipfile will create ZIP files that use the ZIP64 extensions when the zipfile is larger than 4 GiB .
Returns input_charset as a string coerced to lower case .
Get current state of a generator-iterator . With arguments `generator`.
Similar to loadTestsFromName ( ) , but takes a sequence of `names` rather than a single name . With arguments `module`.
Construct a PrettyPrinter instance . If `compact` is false ( the default ) each item of a long sequence will be formatted on a separate line .
This method is not defined in BaseHandler , but subclasses should define it if they want to catch all URLs . With arguments `req`.

Return a reader object which will iterate over lines in the given `csvfile` . 1 An optional `dialect` parameter can be given which is used to define a set of parameters specific to a particular CSV dialect . With arguments `**fmtparams`.
This class is the low-level building block of the module . The `html` argument was historically used for backwards compatibility and is now deprecated .
Return the value of the named attribute of `object` . `name` must be a string .
A SQLite database connection has the following attributes and methods:
Set the available `ciphers` for sockets created with this context .
Byte-compile all the .py files found along sys.path . With arguments `force`.
The popitem ( ) method for ordered dictionaries returns and removes a ( key , value ) pair . The pairs are returned in LIFO order if `last` is true or FIFO order if false .
Mark the Future as done and set its `result` .
Like assertRaises ( ) but also tests that `regex` matches on the string representation of the raised `exception` .
Display a horizontal line starting at ( `y` , `x` ) with length `n` consisting of the character `ch` .

Open a ZIP `file` , where file can be a path to a file ( a string ) , a file-like object or a path-like object . `compression` is the ZIP compression method to use when writing the archive , and should be ZIP_STORED , ZIP_DEFLATED , ZIP_BZIP2 or ZIP_LZMA ; unrecognized values will cause NotImplementedError to be raised . If `allowZip64` is True ( the default ) zipfile will create ZIP files that use the ZIP64 extensions when the zipfile is larger than 4 GiB .

Enter a polling loop that terminates after `count` passes or all open channels have been closed . The `timeout` argument sets the timeout parameter for the appropriate select ( ) or poll ( ) call , measured in seconds ; the default is 30 seconds . The `use_poll` parameter , if true , indicates that poll ( ) should be used in preference to select ( ) ( the default is False ) . The `map` parameter is a dictionary whose items are the channels to watch .
A generic version of collections.deque . With arguments `deque`.
Return data for response `code` if received , or None .
Return the complex number x with polar coordinates `r` and `phi` .
Return information about the transport or underlying resources it uses . `name` is a string representing the piece of transport-specific information to get .
Return a proxy object that delegates method calls to a parent or sibling class of `type` .

A command-line program that loads a set of tests from `module` and runs them ; this is primarily for making test modules conveniently executable . The `defaultTest` argument is either the name of a single test or an iterable of test names to run if no test names are specified via `argv` .

This method makes a backup of a SQLite database even while it ’ s being accessed by other clients , or concurrently by the same connection . The copy will be written into the mandatory argument `target` , that must be another Connection instance . The `sleep` argument specifies the number of seconds to sleep by between successive attempts to backup remaining pages , can be specified either as an integer or a floating point value .
Set a Cookie , without checking with policy to see whether or not it should be set . With arguments `cookie`.
Checks if an object appears to be a valid `element` object .
Extract the `device` major number from a raw device number ( usually the st_dev or st_rdev field from stat ) .
Scan through `string` looking for the first location where the regular expression `pattern` produces a match , and return a corresponding match object . With arguments `flags`.

Load a module that was previously found by find_module ( ) ( or by an otherwise conducted search yielding compatible results ) . The `name` argument indicates the full module name ( including the package name , if this is a submodule of a package ) . The `file` argument is an open file , and `pathname` is the corresponding file name ; these can be None and `` , respectively , when the module is a package or not being loaded from a file . The `description` argument is a tuple , as would be returned by get_suffixes ( ) , describing what kind of module must be loaded .
Return a value for the context variable for the current context . With arguments `default`.
All arguments are optional and default to 0 . Only `days` , `seconds` and `microseconds` are stored internally .
Paint character `ch` at ( `y` , `x` ) with attributes `attr` , overwriting any character previously painter at that location .
Instances of this class represent loaded shared libraries . With arguments `name`, `mode`.

Outputs a symbolic disassembly of the `pickle` to the file-like object `out` , defaulting to sys.stdout . Successive levels , indicated by MARK opcodes in the stream , are indented by `indentlevel` spaces .
Return `digest` of `msg` for given secret `key` and digest .
Add a `callback` to be run when the Future is done .
Called once for each element type declaration . `name` is the name of the element type , and `model` is a representation of the content model .

Return a reverse iterator . `seq` must be an object which has a __reversed__ ( ) method or supports the sequence protocol ( the __len__ ( ) method and the __getitem__ ( ) method with integer arguments starting at 0 ) .

An HTTPConnection instance represents one transaction with an HTTP server . It should be instantiated passing it a `host` and optional `port` number . If the optional `timeout` parameter is given , blocking operations ( like connection attempts ) will timeout after that many seconds ( if it is not given , the global default timeout setting is used ) .
Execute a `code` object .

snippet: sqlite3.connect(database, timeout, detect_types, isolation_level, check_same_thread, factory, cached_statements)
intent: Opens a connection to the SQLite `database` file database . The `timeout` parameter specifies how long the connection should wait for the lock to go away until raising an exception . The `detect_types` parameter and the using custom converters registered with the module-level register_converter ( ) function allow you to easily do that . For the `isolation_level` parameter , please see the isolation_level property of Connection objects . By default , `check_same_thread` is True and only the creating thread may use the connection . By default returns a Connection object , unless a custom `factory` is given . If you want to explicitly set the number of statements that are cached for the connection , you can set the `cached_statements` parameter .
Report that the `test` runner is about to process the given `example` . `out` is the output function that was passed to DocTestRunner.run ( ) .
