Return a new sorted list from the items in `iterable` . `reverse` is a boolean value .
Return the position of `x` in the deque ( at or after index `start` and before index `stop` ) .
Log in on an SMTP server that requires authentication . The arguments are the username and the `password` to authenticate with . With arguments `user`.
Call `func` with arguments `args` and keyword arguments `kwds` .

Convert the characters ' & ' , ' < ' and ' > ' in string `s` to HTML-safe sequences . If the optional flag `quote` is true , the quotation mark character ( `` ) is also translated ; this helps for inclusion in an HTML attribute value delimited by double quotes , as in < a href= '' ... '' > .
This function is a decorator that is used to add generated special methods to classes , as described below . With arguments `init`.
Return `n` independent iterators from a single `iterable` .
Insert a new item with value `x` in the array before position `i` .

Process objects represent activity that is run in a separate process . `group` should always be None ; it exists solely for compatibility with threading.Thread . `name` is the process name ( see name for more details ) .
numeric argument to operation (if any), otherwise None
Return a list with the `n` largest elements from the dataset defined by `iterable` .
Called by the parser to give the application a `locator` for locating the origin of document events .
Construct a new Decimal object based from `value` .
This function accepts an ST object from the caller in `st` and returns a Python list representing the equivalent parse tree .
All arguments are optional and default to 0 . With arguments `minutes`.
Same as compilest ( st , `filename` ) .

Convert a mapping object or a sequence of two-element tuples , which may contain str or bytes objects , to a percent-encoded ASCII text string . When a sequence of two-element tuples is used as the `query` argument , the first element of each tuple is a key and the second is a value . The value element in itself can be a sequence and in that case , if the optional parameter `doseq` is evaluates to True , individual key=value pairs separated by ' & ' are generated for each element of the value sequence for the key . For maximum control of what is quoted , use quote and specify a value for `safe` .

Copy a network object denoted by a URL to a local file . If the `url` uses the http : scheme identifier , the optional `data` argument may be given to specify a POST request ( normally the request type is GET ) . If the URL points to a local file , the object will not be copied unless `filename` is supplied .
Increments the progress bar ’ s value by `amount` .
Print objects to the text stream `file` , separated by `sep` and followed by `end` . With arguments `*objects`.
Return a generator of groups with up to `n` lines of context .

The first version requires that numerator and denominator are instances of numbers.Rational and returns a new Fraction instance with value numerator/denominator . where the optional sign may be either ‘ + ’ or ‘ - ‘ and numerator and denominator ( if present ) are strings of `decimal` digits .
Return a guess for whether wsgi.url_scheme should be “ http ” or “ https ” , by checking for a HTTPS environment variable in the `environ` dictionary .

This function imports and returns a `fresh` copy of the named Python module by removing the named module from sys.modules before doing the import . `blocked` is an iterable of module names that are replaced with None in the module cache during the import to ensure that attempts to import them raise ImportError . With arguments `name`.
Objects that when printed , print a message like “ Use quit ( ) or Ctrl-D ( i.e . EOF ) to exit ” , and when called , raise SystemExit with the specified exit `code` .
Return an iterator of the summarized network range given the `first` and `last` IP addresses .
Return the number of the color-pair set by the attribute value `attr` .
Return True if d has a key key, else False.

The first version returns the nearest int to self , rounding half to even . The second version rounds self to the nearest multiple of Fraction ( 1 , 10**ndigits ) ( logically , if `ndigits` is negative ) , again rounding half toward even .
This method modifies the Stats object by sorting it according to the supplied criteria . With arguments `*keys`.
An implementation of the built-in __import__ ( ) function . With arguments `name`, `globals`.
Subscribe to new `mailbox` .

Return a new “ bytes ” object , which is an immutable sequence of integers in the range 0 < = x < 256. bytes is an immutable version of bytearray – it has the same non-mutating methods and the same indexing and slicing behavior .
Return a `k` sized list of elements chosen from the `population` with replacement .
Add element `elem` to the set .
The arguments are an `object` and a string . The result is True if the string is the `name` of one of the object ’ s attributes , False if not .
Print objects to the text stream `file` , separated by `sep` and followed by `end` . With arguments `*objects`.

Decode the Base64 encoded bytes-like object or ASCII string `s` and return the decoded bytes . If `validate` is False ( the default ) , characters that are neither in the normal base-64 alphabet nor the alternative alphabet are discarded prior to the padding check .

Return a string representing the date and time in ISO 8601 format , YYYY-MM-DDTHH : MM : SS.ffffff or , if microsecond is 0 , YYYY-MM-DDTHH : MM : SS The optional argument `timespec` specifies the number of additional components of the time to include ( the default is 'auto ' ) .
Enable `capability` ( see RFC 5161 ) .
Read data from the stream until `separator` is found .
Context manager to check that no ResourceWarning was raised . With arguments `testcase`.
Create a filesystem node ( file , `device` special file or named pipe ) named `path` .
Create an object to `trace` execution of a single statement or expression . `count` enables counting of line numbers .
Context manager to check that no ResourceWarning was raised . With arguments `testcase`.

This function is invoked by the import statement . The function imports the module `name` , potentially using the given `globals` and `locals` to determine how to interpret the name in a package context . `level` specifies whether to use absolute or relative imports .
Bootstraps pip into the current or designated environment . `user` indicates whether to use the user scheme rather than installing globally .

A decorator for running a function in a different locale , correctly resetting it after it has finished . `catstr` is the locale category as a string ( for example `` LC_ALL '' ) . With arguments `*locales`.
A helper function to create a `mock` to replace the use of open ( ) .
A condition variable : an alias for threading.Condition . If `lock` is specified then it should be a Lock or RLock object from multiprocessing .

Call the underlying PlaySound ( ) function from the Platform API . The `sound` parameter may be a filename , a system sound alias , audio data as a bytes-like object , or None . Its interpretation depends on the value of `flags` , which can be a bitwise ORed combination of the constants described below .
Write the `row` parameter to the writer ’ s file object , formatted according to the current dialect .

Given a string representing one Unicode character , return an integer representing the Unicode code point of that character . With arguments `c`.

Return a m-column calendar for an entire year as a multi-line string . Optional parameters `w` , `l` , and `c` are for date column width , lines per week , and number of spaces between month columns , respectively . With arguments `theyear`.
Log in as the given `user` . The `passwd` and `acct` parameters are optional and default to the empty string .
Return a new record object by calling MSICreateRecord ( ) . `count` is the number of fields of the record .

With one argument , returns a dictionary of column/value pairs for the specified `item` . With two arguments , returns the current `value` of the specified `column` .
Draw a circle with given `radius` . The center is radius units left of the turtle ; `extent` – an angle – determines which part of the circle is drawn .

Returns a compression object , to be used for compressing data streams that won ’ t fit into memory at once . `level` is the compression level – an integer from 0 to 9 or -1 . `method` is the compression algorithm .

patch the named member ( `attribute` ) on an object ( `target` ) with a mock object . Arguments `new` , `spec` , `create` , `spec_set` , `autospec` and `new_callable` have the same meaning as for patch ( ) . With arguments `**kwargs`.

Execute the program `path` in a new process . If `mode` is P_NOWAIT , this function returns the process id of the new process ; if mode is P_WAIT , returns the process ’ s exit code if it exits normally , or -signal , where signal is the signal that killed the process . For spawnle ( ) , spawnlpe ( ) , spawnve ( ) , and spawnvpe ( ) ( note that these all end in “ e ” ) , the `env` parameter must be a mapping which is used to define the environment variables for the new process ( they are used instead of the current process ’ environment ) ; the functions spawnl ( ) , spawnlp ( ) , spawnv ( ) , and spawnvp ( ) all cause the new process to inherit the environment of the current process .

Return a 2-tuple ; the first element is a string containing the command line to be executed ( which can be passed to os.system ( ) ) , and the second element is the mailcap entry for a given MIME type . `key` is the name of the field desired , which represents the type of activity to be performed ; the default value is ‘ view ’ , since in the most common case you simply want to view the body of the MIME-typed data . With arguments `caps`.

This function causes the cgitb module to take over the interpreter ’ s default handling for exceptions by setting the value of sys.excepthook . The optional argument `display` defaults to 1 and can be set to 0 to suppress sending the traceback to the browser .
Construct a URL from a tuple as returned by urlparse ( ) . The `parts` argument can be any six-item iterable .

Simple writer class which writes output on the `file` object passed in as file or , if file is omitted , on standard output . The output is simply word-wrapped to the number of columns specified by `maxcol` .

Raised when the interpreter finds an internal error, but the situation does not look so serious to cause it to abandon all hope.

This function is useful for programs that want to emulate Python ’ s interpreter main loop ( a.k.a . `source` is the source string ; `filename` is the optional filename from which source was read , defaulting to ' < input > ' ; and `symbol` is the optional grammar start symbol , which should be either 'single ' ( the default ) or 'eval ' .

Convert a mapping object or a sequence of two-element tuples , which may contain str or bytes objects , to a percent-encoded ASCII text string . When a sequence of two-element tuples is used as the `query` argument , the first element of each tuple is a key and the second is a value .
Split the string at the first occurrence of `sep` , and return a 3-tuple containing the part before the separator , the separator itself , and the part after the separator .

Like gettext ( ) , but consider `plural` forms . If no translation is found , return `singular` if n is 1 ; return plural otherwise . If a translation is found , apply the plural formula to `n` , and return the resulting message ( some languages have more than two plural forms ) .

`word` will usually be a user ’ s password as typed at a prompt or in a graphical interface . The optional `salt` is either a string as returned from mksalt ( ) , one of the crypt.METHOD_* values ( though not all may be available on all platforms ) , or a full encrypted password including salt , as returned by this function .

Similar to the parse ( ) method , except it takes a string object instead of a file-like object . Calling this method on a string is equivalent to wrapping `text` in a StringIO instance first and calling parse ( ) .
Read `n` items ( as machine values ) from the file object `f` and append them to the end of the array .
Return a property attribute .

Open `file` and return a corresponding file object . In text mode , if `encoding` is not specified the encoding used is platform dependent : locale.getpreferredencoding ( False ) is called to get the current locale encoding .

This function is identical to the fcntl ( ) function , except that the argument handling is even more complicated . The `request` parameter is limited to values that can fit in 32-bits . The parameter `arg` can be one of an integer , an object supporting the read-only buffer interface ( like bytes ) or an object supporting the read-write buffer interface ( like bytearray ) . With arguments `fd`.
Write text - the string representation of `arg` - at the current turtle position according to `align` ( “ left ” , “ center ” or right ” ) and with the given `font` . With arguments `8`, `"normal")`.

This class implements `temporary` breakpoints , ignore counts , disabling and ( re- ) enabling , and conditionals . Breakpoints are indexed by number through a list called bpbynumber and by ( `file` , `line` ) pairs through bplist . With arguments `self`, `cond`.
Translate an Internet `port` number and protocol name to a service name for that service .

This function operates exactly as TemporaryFile ( ) does , except that the file is guaranteed to have a visible name in the file system ( on Unix , the directory entry is not unlinked ) . If `delete` is true ( the default ) , the file is deleted as soon as it is closed .
Return a tuple of class `cls` ’ s base classes , including cls , in method resolution order .
Wrap an existing Python socket `sock` and return an instance of SSLContext.sslsocket_class ( default SSLSocket ) . `session` , see session .
Returns the lowest index in the object where the subsequence `sub` is found , such that sub is contained in the range [ `start` , `end` ] .

This function implements the standard .mo file search algorithm . It takes a `domain` , identical to what textdomain ( ) takes . If `all` is given , it returns a list of all file names , in the order in which they appear in the languages list or the environment variables .
Equivalent to not key in d.
Packs a fixed length opaque `data` stream , similarly to pack_fstring ( ) . With arguments `n`.
Returns an approximation of the Header as a string , using an unlimited line length .

Test examples associated with object `f` ; for example , f may be a string , a module , a function , or a class object . A shallow copy of dictionary argument `globs` is used for the execution context . Optional argument `optionflags` works as for function testfile ( ) above .

Listen for connections made to the socket . The `backlog` argument specifies the maximum number of queued connections and should be at least 1 ; the maximum value is system-dependent ( usually 5 ) .

Convert the color from YIQ coordinates to RGB coordinates . With arguments `y`, `i`, `q`.
Decodes data from the stream and returns the resulting object . The `size` argument indicates the approximate maximum number of encoded bytes or code points to read for decoding .

The false value of the bool type.
